filed by Section 13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the
preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that the registrant was
required to file such reports), and (2) has been subject to such filing requirements
for the past 90 days. <br>

whether the registrant is a large accelerated filer, an accelerated filer, or a
non-accelerated filer. See definition of &#147;accelerated filer and large
accelerated filer&#148; in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act. (Check one):</font></p>

shell company (as defined in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 of the Exchange Act). Yes&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font face="Wingdings">o</font>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<font face="Wingdings">x</font></p>

outstanding, and 1,180,000,000 shares of the registrant&#146;s Class B Common Stock
outstanding.</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART I - FINANCIAL INFORMATION<a name="PartIFinancialInformation_135148"></a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 3.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 1.&#160; Financial Statements.<a name="Item1_FinancialStatements__135153"></a></font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

dollars)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Condensed Consolidated
Statements of Shareholders&#146; Equity<a name="CondensedConsolidatedStatementsOf_153246"></a></font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the Year Ended December 31, 2005 and</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the Six Months Ended June 30, 2006</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(in millions of dollars,
except per share data)</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.14%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
comprehensive earnings were $1,043 million and $262 million, respectively, for
the quarters ended June 30, 2006 and 2005 and $957 million for the first six
months of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See notes to condensed
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">7</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="77%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:77.44%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">9</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\knatara\06-15579-1\task1274482\15579-1-do.htm',USER='knatarajan',CD='Aug  4 15:45 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements<a name="NotesToCondensedConsolidatedFinan_161113"></a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 3.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
1.&#160; Accounting Policies:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Basis of
Presentation</font></i></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The interim
condensed consolidated financial statements of Kraft Foods Inc. (&#147;Kraft&#148;),
together with its subsidiaries (collectively referred to as the &#147;Company&#148;), are
unaudited.&#160; It is the opinion of the
Company&#146;s management that all adjustments necessary for a fair statement of the
interim results presented have been reflected therein.&#160; All such adjustments were of a normal
recurring nature.&#160; Net revenues and net
earnings for any interim period are not necessarily indicative of results that
may be expected for the entire year.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">These statements
should be read in conjunction with the Company&#146;s consolidated financial
statements and related notes, which are included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report
on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2005.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the
Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business for pre-tax
proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion.&#160;
The Company has reflected the results of its sugar confectionery
business prior to the closing date as discontinued operations on the condensed
consolidated statements of earnings.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2005,
the Company announced that, effective January 1, 2006, its Canadian business
will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American
business by product category.&#160; Beginning
in the first quarter of 2006, the operating results of the Canadian business
are being reported throughout the North American food segments.&#160; In addition, in the first quarter of 2006,
the Company&#146;s international businesses were realigned to reflect the
reorganization announced within Europe in November 2005.&#160; The two revised international segments, which
are reflected in these condensed consolidated financial statements and notes,
are European Union; and Developing Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia, the
latter to reflect the Company&#146;s increased management focus on developing
markets.&#160; Accordingly, prior period
segment results have been restated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock-Based Compensation Expense</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective
January 1, 2006, the Company adopted the provisions of Statement of Financial
Accounting Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;) No. 123 (Revised 2004), &#147;Share-Based Payment,&#148; (&#147;SFAS
No. 123(R)&#148;) using the modified prospective method, which requires measurement
of compensation cost for all stock-based awards at fair value on date of grant
and recognition of compensation over the service periods for awards expected to
vest.&#160; The fair value of restricted stock
and rights to receive shares of stock is determined based on the number of
shares granted and the market value at date of grant.&#160; The fair value of stock options is determined
using a modified Black-Scholes methodology.&#160;
The impact of adoption was not material.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company previously applied the recognition and measurement principles of
Accounting Principles Board Opinion No. 25, &#147;Accounting for Stock Issued to
Employees,&#148; (&#147;APB 25&#148;) and provided the pro forma disclosures required by SFAS
No. 123, &#147;Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation&#148; (&#147;SFAS No. 123&#148;). No
compensation expense for employee stock options was reflected in net earnings
in 2005, as all stock options granted under those plans had an exercise price
equal to the market value of the common stock on the date of the grant.&#160; Historical condensed consolidated statements
of earnings already include the compensation expense for restricted stock and
rights to receive shares of stock.&#160; The
following table illustrates the effect on net earnings and earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;)
if the Company had applied the fair value recognition provisions of SFAS No.
123 to measure stock-based compensation expense for stock option awards in
2005:</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">10</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\fc\21617491031_D11113_1277680\15579-1-dq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 17:49 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.70</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="95" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:71.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.28</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="395" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:296.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 50.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Diluted &#150; pro
  forma</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="95" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:71.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.69</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="95" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:71.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.28</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
adoption of SFAS No. 123(R) in the first quarter of 2006 resulted in a
cumulative effect gain of $6 million, which is net of $3 million in taxes, in
the condensed consolidated statements of earnings for the six months ended June
30, 2006.&#160; This gain resulted from the
impact of estimating future forfeitures on restricted stock and rights to receive
shares of stock in the determination of periodic expense for unvested awards,
rather than recording forfeitures only when they occur.&#160; The gross cumulative effect was recorded in
marketing, administration and research costs in the first quarter of 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under
SFAS No. 123(R), tax shortfalls occur when actual tax deductible compensation
expense is less than cumulative stock-based compensation expense recognized in
the financial statements.&#160; Tax shortfalls
of $10 million were recognized for the six months ended June 30, 2006, and were
recorded in additional paid-in capital.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
2.&#160; Asset Impairment, Exit and
Implementation Costs: </font></u></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring
Program:</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In January&nbsp;2004, the Company announced a three-year
restructuring program with the objectives of leveraging the Company&#146;s global
scale, realigning and lowering its cost structure, and optimizing capacity
utilization. I</font>n January
2006, the Company announced plans to expand its restructuring efforts through
2008.&#160; The entire restructuring program
is expected to result in $3.7 billion in pre-tax charges reflecting asset
disposals, severance and implementation costs.&#160;
As part of this program, the Company anticipates the closure of up to 40
facilities and the elimination of approximately 14,000 positions.&#160; Approximately $2.3 billion of the $3.7
billion in pre-tax charges are expected to require cash payments.&#160; P<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">re-tax
restructuring program charges during 2006 are expected to be approximately $1
billion, including $348 million incurred for the six months ended June 30,
2006.&#160; Total pre-tax restructuring charges
incurred since the inception of the program in January 2004 were $1.3 billion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the second quarter of 2006, the Company announced a seven-year, $1.7 billion
agreement to receive information technology services from Electronic Data
Systems (&#147;EDS&#148;).&#160; The agreement, which
includes data centers, web hosting, telecommunications and IT workplace
services, began on June 1, 2006.&#160;
Pursuant to the agreement, approximately 670 employees, who provide
certain IT support to the Company, were transitioned to EDS.&#160; As a result, in the second quarter of 2006,
the Company incurred pre-tax asset impairment and exit costs of $3 million and
implementation costs of $11 million related to the transition.&#160; These costs were included in the pre-tax
restructuring program charges discussed above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">11</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\fc\21617491031_D11113_1277680\15579-1-dq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 17:49 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring
Costs:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the six
months and three months ended June 30, 2006, pre-tax charges under the
restructuring program of $318 million and $226 million, respectively, were
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statements of earnings.&#160; During the six
months and three months ended June 30, 2005, pre-tax charges under the
restructuring program of $86 million and $29 million, respectively, were
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statements of earnings.&#160; The pre-tax
charges for the six months ended June 30, 2006 resulted from the announcement
of the closing of seven plants, for a total of 26 since January 2004, and the
continuation of a number of workforce reduction programs.&#160; Approximately $133 million of the pre-tax
charges incurred during the first six months of 2006 will require cash
payments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pre-tax restructuring
liability activity for the six months ended June 30, 2006 was as follows:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt .0001pt 0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Severance costs in
the above schedule, which relate to the workforce reduction programs, include
the cost of related benefits.&#160; Specific
programs announced since 2004, as part of the overall restructuring program,
will result in the elimination of approximately 8,600 positions.&#160; At June 30, 2006, approximately 7,200 of
these positions have been eliminated.&#160;
Asset write-downs relate to the impairment of assets caused by the plant
closings and related activity.&#160; Other
costs incurred relate primarily to contract termination costs associated with
the plant closings and the termination of leasing agreements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Implementation
Costs:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
recorded pre-tax implementation costs associated with the restructuring
program.&#160; These costs include the
discontinuance of certain product lines and incremental costs related to the
integration and streamlining of functions and closure of facilities.&#160; Substantially all implementation costs
incurred in 2006 will require cash payments.&#160;
These costs were recorded on the condensed consolidated statements of
earnings as follows: </font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-left:20.0pt;">

  <td width="64" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:47.9pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="295" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:221.5pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="303" colspan="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:227.6pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(in&nbsp;millions)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">12</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\fc\21617491031_D11113_1277680\15579-1-dq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 17:49 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Asset
Impairment Charges:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July 2006, the
Company completed the sale of its pet snacks brand and assets for $580 million
and recorded additional taxes of approximately $60 million related to the
sale.&#160; This sale and the additional taxes
were recorded in the third quarter of 2006.&#160;
The Company incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $86 million in
the first quarter of 2006 in recognition of this sale.&#160; The charge, which included the write-off of a
portion of the associated goodwill, and intangible and fixed assets, was
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statement of earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second
quarter of 2005, the Company completed the sale of its fruit snacks assets for
approximately $30 million.&#160; The Company
incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $93 million in the first quarter of
2005 in recognition of the sale.&#160; The
charge, which included the write-off of all associated intangible assets, was
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statement of earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first
quarter of 2006, the Company completed its annual review of goodwill and
intangible assets and recorded non-cash pre-tax charges of $24 million related
to an intangible asset impairment for biscuits assets in Egypt and hot cereal
assets in the United States.&#160; These
charges were recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed
consolidated statement of earnings.&#160;
During the first quarter of 2005, the Company completed its annual
review of goodwill and intangible assets and no charges resulted from this
review.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Total:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The pre-tax asset
impairment, exit and implementation costs discussed above, for the six months
and three months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005, were included in the operating
companies income of the following segments:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">13</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\fc\21617491031_D11113_1277680\15579-1-dq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 17:49 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="35%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:35.94%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.98%;">

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Implementation<br>
  Costs</font></b></p>
  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
3.&#160; Related Party Transactions:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At June 30, 2006, Altria
Group, Inc. owned 88.1% of the Company&#146;s outstanding shares of capital
stock.&#160; Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s subsidiary,
Altria Corporate Services, Inc., provides the Company with various services,
including planning, legal, treasury, auditing, insurance, human resources,
office of the secretary, corporate affairs, information technology, aviation
and tax services.&#160; Billings for these
services, which were based on the cost to Altria Corporate Services, Inc. to
provide such services and a 5% management fee based on wages and benefits, were
$102 million and $126 million for the six months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005,
respectively, and $50 million and $63 million for the three months ended June
30, 2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At June 30, 2006, the
Company had short-term amounts payable to Altria Group, Inc. of $485
million.&#160; The amounts payable to Altria
Group, Inc. generally include accrued dividends, taxes and service fees.&#160; Interest on intercompany borrowings is based
on the applicable London Interbank Offered Rate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the second quarter of
2006, the Company purchased certain real estate and certain personal property
located in Wilkes Barre, Pennsylvania, from Altria Corporate Services, Inc.,
for an aggregate purchase price of $9.3 million.&#160; In addition, during the second quarter of 2006,
the Company assumed all of Altria Corporate Services, Inc.&#146;s rights under a
lease for certain real property located in San Antonio, Texas.&#160; The Company also purchased certain personal
property located in San Antonio, Texas from Altria Corporate Services, Inc.,
for an aggregate purchase price of $6.0 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Also, see Note 12. <i>Income Taxes</i> regarding the impact to the Company of the
closure of an Internal Revenue Service review of Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s
consolidated federal income tax return recorded during the first quarter of
2006. </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">15</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\fc\216175651436_D11113_1277680\15579-1-ds.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 17:57 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
4.&#160; Divestitures:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Discontinued
Operations:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the
Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business for pre-tax
proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion.&#160;
The sale included the <i>Life Savers</i>, <i>Creme Savers</i>, <i>Altoids</i>, <i>Trolli</i> and <i>Sugus</i>
brands.&#160; The Company has reflected the
results of its sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as
discontinued operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Summary results of
operations for the sugar confectionery business were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The loss on sale
of discontinued operations, above, for the six months and three months ended
June 30, 2005, related largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second
quarter of 2006, the Company sold its industrial coconut assets.&#160; During the first quarter of 2006, the Company
sold certain Canadian assets and a small U.S. biscuit brand, and incurred
pre-tax asset impairment charges of $176 million in the fourth quarter of 2005
in recognition of these sales.&#160; During
the second quarter of 2005, the Company sold its fruit snacks assets and
incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $93 million in the first quarter
of 2005 in recognition of this sale.&#160;
During the first quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts
assets, its U.S. yogurt assets and a minor trademark in Mexico.&#160; The aggregate proceeds received from these
sales during the first six months of 2006 and 2005 were $91 million and $221
million, respectively.&#160; The Company
recorded pre-tax losses from sales of businesses of $11 million during the
first six months of 2006, and recorded pre-tax gains from sales of businesses
of $115 million during the first six months of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July 2006, the
Company completed the sale of its pet snacks brand and assets for $580 million
and recorded additional taxes of approximately $60 million related to the
sale.&#160; This sale and the additional taxes
were recorded in the third quarter of 2006.&#160;
The Company incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $86 million in
the first quarter of 2006 in recognition of this sale.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The operating
results of the other divestitures, discussed above, in the aggregate, were not
material to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
operations or cash flows in any of the periods presented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 5.
Stock Plans:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Kraft 2005 Performance Incentive Plan (the &#147;2005 Plan&#148;), the
Company may grant to eligible employees awards of stock options, stock
appreciation rights, restricted stock, restricted and deferred stock units, and
other awards based on the Company&#146;s Class A common stock, as well as
performance-based annual and long-term incentive awards.&#160; A maximum of 150 million shares of the
Company&#146;s Class A common stock may be issued under the 2005 Plan, of which no
more than 45 million shares may be awarded as restricted stock.&#160; In addition, under the Kraft 2006 Stock
Compensation Plan for Non-Employee Directors (the &#147;2006 Directors Plan&#148;), the
Company may grant up to 500,000 shares of Class A common stock to members of
the Board of Directors who are not full-time employees of the Company or Altria
Group, Inc., or their subsidiaries, over a five-year period.&#160; Shares available to be granted under the 2005
Plan and the 2006 Directors Plan at June 30, 2006, were 143,326,485 and
481,555, respectively.&#160; Restricted shares
available for grant under the 2005 Plan at June 30, 2006, were 38,326,485.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">16</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\fc\216175651436_D11113_1277680\15579-1-ds.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 17:57 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Generally, stock options are granted at an exercise price equal to the
fair value of the underlying stock on the date of the grant, become exercisable
on the first anniversary of the grant date and have a maximum term of ten
years.&#160; However, the Company has not
granted stock options to its employees since 2002.&#160; Restricted stock generally vests on the third
anniversary of the grant date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock Option Plan</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock option activity was as follows for the six months ended June 30,
2006:</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Remaining</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Aggregate</font></b></p>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="222" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:166.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exercisable at June 30,
  2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14,687,180</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31.00</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="222" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="69" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="62" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="69" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="62" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="2" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The total intrinsic value of options exercised was $0.1 million and
$0.6 million during the six months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005, respectively,
and $0.1 million and $0.2 million, during the three months ended June 30, 2006
and 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to the initial public offering (&#147;IPO&#148;), certain employees of the
Company participated in Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s stock compensation plans.&#160; Altria Group, Inc. does not intend to issue
additional Altria Group, Inc. stock compensation to the Company&#146;s employees,
except for reloads of previously issued options.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pre-tax compensation cost and the related tax benefit for Altria stock
option awards for reloads totaled $2.0 million and $0.7 million, respectively,
for the six months ended June 30, 2006 and $0.6 million and $0.2 million,
respectively, for the three months ended June 30, 2006.&#160; The fair value of the awards was determined
using a modified Black-Scholes methodology using the following assumptions for
Altria Group, Inc. common stock:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s employees held options to purchase the following number of shares of
Altria Group, Inc. stock at June 30, 2006:</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Restricted Stock Plans</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company may grant shares of restricted stock and rights to receive
shares of stock to eligible employees, giving them in most instances all of the
rights of stockholders, except that they may not sell, assign, pledge or
otherwise encumber such shares and rights.&#160;
Such shares and rights are subject to forfeiture if certain employment
conditions are not met.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of the restricted shares and rights at the date of grant
is amortized to expense ratably over the restriction period.&#160; The Company recorded pre-tax compensation
expense related to restricted stock and rights of $61 million (including the
pre-tax cumulative effect gain of $9 million from the adoption of SFAS No.
123(R)) and $76 million for the six months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005,
respectively, and $38 million for the three months ended June 30, 2006 and
2005.&#160; The deferred tax benefit recorded
related to this compensation expense was $22 million and $28 million for the
six months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005, respectively, and $14 million, for the
three months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005. The unamortized compensation expense
related to the Company&#146;s restricted stock and rights was $292 million at June
30, 2006 and is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of two
years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s restricted stock and rights activity was as follows for
the six months ended June 30, 2006:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

</div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted&#150;average grant date fair value of restricted stock and
rights granted during the six months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005 was $197
million and $196 million, respectively, or $29.12 and $33.31 per restricted
share or right, respectively.&#160; The total
fair value of restricted stock and rights vested during the six months ended
June 30, 2006 and 2005 was $117 million and $1 million, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">18</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,688</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:1.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="453" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:340.0pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the three months
ended June 30, 2006 and 2005, the number of stock options excluded from the
calculation of weighted average shares for diluted EPS because their effects
were antidilutive (i.e. the cash that would be received upon exercise is
greater than the average market price of the stock during the period) was
immaterial.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
7.&#160; Contingencies:</font></u></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft and its
subsidiaries are parties to a variety of legal proceedings arising out of the
normal course of business, including a few cases in which substantial amounts
of damages are sought.&#160; While the results
of litigation cannot be predicted with certainty, management believes that the
final outcome of these proceedings will not have a material adverse effect on
the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash
flows.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Third-Party
Guarantees:</font></i>&#160; At June
30, 2006, the Company&#146;s third-party guarantees, which are primarily derived
from acquisition and divestiture activities, approximated $24 million.&#160; Substantially all of these guarantees expire
through 2013, with $12 million expiring through June 30, 2007.&#160; The Company is required to perform under
these guarantees in the event that a third party fails to make contractual
payments or achieve performance measures.&#160;
The Company has a liability of $16 million on its condensed consolidated
balance sheet at June 30, 2006, relating to these guarantees.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">19</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note

Net:</font></u></b></p>

segment was as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-amortizable
intangible assets consist substantially of brand names purchased through the
Nabisco acquisition.&#160; Amortizable
intangible assets consist primarily of certain trademark licenses and
non-compete agreements.&#160; Amortization
expense for intangible assets was $5 million for the six months ended June 30,
2006 and 2005, and $3 million and $2 million for the three months ended June
30, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160;
Amortization expense for each of the next five years is currently
estimated to be approximately $10 million or less.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">20</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\fc\21618558805_D11113_1277680\15579-1-du.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:06 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

and gross carrying amount of intangible assets from December 31, 2005, is as
follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
9.&#160; Segment Reporting:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company manufactures
and markets packaged food products, consisting principally of beverages,
cheese, snacks, convenient meals and various packaged grocery products.&#160; Kraft manages and reports operating results
through two units, Kraft North America Commercial and Kraft International
Commercial.&#160; Reportable segments for
Kraft North America Commercial are organized and managed principally by product
category.&#160; Kraft International Commercial&#146;s
operations are organized and managed by geographic location.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2005, the
Company announced that, effective January 1, 2006, its Canadian business will
be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American business
by product category.&#160; Beginning in the
first quarter of 2006, the operating results of the Canadian business are being
reported throughout the North American food segments.&#160; In addition, in the first quarter of 2006,
the Company&#146;s international businesses were realigned to reflect the reorganization
announced within Europe in November 2005.&#160;
The two revised international segments are European Union; and
Developing Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia, the latter to reflect the Company&#146;s
increased management focus on developing markets.&#160; Accordingly, prior period segment results
have been restated.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s ma</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">nagement
uses operating companies income, which is defined as operating income before
general corporate expenses and amortization of intangibles, to evaluate segment
performance and allocate resources.&#160;
Management believes it is appropriate to disclose this measure to help
investors analyze the business performance and trends of the various business
segments.&#160; Interest and other debt
expense, net, and provision for income taxes are centrally managed and,
accordingly, such items are not presented by segment since they are not
included in the measure of segment profitability reviewed by management.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">21</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\fc\21618558805_D11113_1277680\15579-1-du.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:06 2006' -->

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

as follows:</font></p>

  </td>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="453" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:340.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues:</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.1pt;">

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\fc\21618558805_D11113_1277680\15579-1-du.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:06 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,076</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in
Note 2. <i>Asset Impairment, Exit and Implementation Costs</i>,
the Company recorded asset impairment, exit and implementation costs of $458
million and $243 million, respectively, during the six months and three months
ended June 30, 2006, and $224 million and $55 million, respectively, during the
six months and three months ended June 30, 2005.&#160; See Note 2 for a breakdown of these pre-tax
charges by segment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second quarter of 2006, the Company sold
its industrial coconut assets and recorded a pre-tax loss of $8 million.&#160; This loss is included in the operating
companies income of the North America Cheese &amp; Foodservice segment.&#160; During the first quarter of 2006, the Company
sold certain Canadian assets and recorded a pre-tax loss of $1 million.&#160; This loss is included in the operating
companies income of the North America Grocery segment.&#160; In addition, during the first quarter of
2006, the Company sold a small U.S. biscuit brand, resulting in a pre-tax loss
of $2 million.&#160; This loss is included in
the operating companies income of the North America Snacks &amp; Cereals
segment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second quarter of 2005, the Company sold
its fruit snacks assets and recorded a pre-tax loss of $2 million.&#160; This loss is included in the operating
companies income of the North America Grocery segment.&#160; Also in the second quarter of 2005, the
Company recorded a pre-tax gain of $1 million from the sale of its U.S. yogurt
assets.&#160; This gain is included in the
operating companies income of the North America Cheese &amp; Foodservice
segment.&#160; During the first quarter of
2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts assets and recorded a pre-tax gain of
$115 million.&#160; This gain is included in
the operating companies income of the European Union segment.&#160; In addition, the Company sold a minor
trademark in Mexico, resulting in a pre-tax gain of $1 million.&#160; This gain is included in the operating
companies income of the Developing Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia segment.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">23</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\fc\21618558805_D11113_1277680\15579-1-du.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:06 2006' -->

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

Subsidiaries</font></p>

consumer sector, which include the separation of Foodservice into sector
components, were as follows (in millions):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
10.&#160; Financial Instruments:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the six months and three months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005, ineffectiveness
related to cash flow hedges was not material.&#160;
At June 30, 2006, the Company was hedging forecasted transactions for
periods not exceeding the next eighteen months and expects substantially all
amounts reported in accumulated other comprehensive </font><font face="Times New Roman">earnings
(losses) to be reclassified to the consolidated statement of earnings within
the next twelve months.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">24</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\fc\21618558805_D11113_1277680\15579-1-du.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:06 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hedging activities affected accumulated other
comprehensive earnings (losses), net of income taxes, as follows:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

  <td width="54" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:40.75pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
11.&#160; Benefit Plans:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company sponsors noncontributory defined benefit pension plans covering
substantially all U.S. employees.&#160;
Pension coverage for employees of the Company&#146;s non-U.S. subsidiaries is
provided, to the extent deemed appropriate, through separate plans, many of
which are governed by local statutory requirements.&#160; In addition, the Company&#146;s U.S. and Canadian
subsidiaries provide health care and other benefits to substantially all
retired employees.&#160; Health care benefits
for retirees outside the United States and Canada are generally covered through
local government plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pension Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Components of Net Periodic Benefit Cost</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net periodic pension cost
consisted of the following for the six months and three months ended June 30,
2006 and 2005:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and

  </td>

  </td>

</div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other
expense, above, is due primarily to additional pension benefits related to
workforce reduction programs under the Company&#146;s restructuring program and is
included as part of asset impairment and exit costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employer
Contributions</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
presently makes, and plans to make, contributions, to the extent that they are
tax deductible and do not generate an excise tax liability, in order to
maintain plan assets in excess of the accumulated benefit obligation of its
funded U.S. and non-U.S. plans.&#160; During
the six months ended June 30, 2006, approximately $135 million and
approximately $50 million of employer contributions were made to U.S. plans and
non-U.S. plans, respectively.&#160; Currently,
the Company anticipates making additional contributions of approximately $15
million during the remainder of 2006 to its U.S. plans and approximately $60
million during the remainder of 2006 to its non-U.S. plans, based on current
tax law.&#160; However, these estimates are
subject to change as a result of many factors, including changes in tax and
other benefit laws, as well as asset performance significantly above or below
the assumed long-term rate of return on pension assets, or significant changes
in interest rates.&#160; During the six months
ended June 30, 2005, approximately $200 million and approximately $50 million
of employer contributions were made to U.S. plans and non-U.S. plans,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Postretirement Benefit Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net postretirement
health care costs consisted of the following for the six months and three
months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005:</font></p>
