  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="54" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:40.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">63</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">26</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='26',FILE='C:\fc\216185435795_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:54 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
12.&#160; Income Taxes:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for
income taxes in accordance with SFAS No. 109, &#147;Accounting for Income Taxes.&#148;
The U.S. accounts of the Company are included in the consolidated federal
income tax return of Altria Group, Inc.&#160;
Income taxes are generally computed on a separate company basis.&#160; To the extent that foreign tax credits,
capital losses and other credits generated by the Company, which cannot
currently be utilized on a separate company basis, are utilized in Altria
Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax return, the benefit is recognized
in the calculation of the Company&#146;s provision for income taxes.&#160; The Company makes payments to, or is
reimbursed by, Altria Group, Inc. for the tax effects resulting from its
inclusion in Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax return,
including current taxes payable and net changes in tax provisions.&#160; Significant judgment is required in
determining income tax provisions and in evaluating tax positions.&#160; The Company establishes additional provisions
for income taxes when, despite the belief that existing tax positions are fully
supportable, there remain certain positions that are likely to be challenged
and that may not be sustained on review by tax authorities.&#160; The Company evaluates and potentially adjusts
these provisions in light of changing facts and circumstances.&#160; The consolidated tax provision includes the
impact of changes to accruals deemed necessary.&#160;
Upon the closure of current and future tax audits in various
jurisdictions, significant income tax accrual reversals could continue to
occur, which could trigger cash reimbursements from Altria Group, Inc.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company is regularly audited by federal, state and foreign tax authorities, and
these audits are at various stages at any given time.&#160; Any tax contingency reserves in excess of
additional assessed liabilities will be reversed at the time the audits close.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
the first quarter of 2006, the United States Internal Revenue Service concluded
its examination of Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated tax returns for the years
1996 through 1999 and issued a final Revenue Agents Report on March 15,
2006.&#160;&#160; Consequently, Altria Group, Inc.
reimbursed the Company in cash for unrequired federal tax reserves of $337
million and pre-tax interest of $46 million ($29 million after-tax).&#160; The Company also recognized net state tax
reversals of $39 million, resulting in a total net earnings benefit of $405
million or $0.24 per diluted share, for the six months ended June 30, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
July 2006, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued FASB
Interpretation No. 48, &#147;Accounting for the Uncertainty in Income Taxes - an
interpretation of FASB Statement No. 109,&#148; which will become effective for the
Company on January 1, 2007.&#160; The
Interpretation prescribes a recognition threshold and a measurement attribute
for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken
in a tax return.&#160; The Company and Altria
Group, Inc. are presently evaluating the impact of FASB Interpretation No. 48
and currently believe that its adoption will result in an increase to
shareholders&#146; equity on January 1, 2007, which might be significant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 13.&#160;
Subsequent Events:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">United Biscuits Agreement</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
July 2006, the Company announced an agreement with United Biscuits (&#147;UB&#148;) to
acquire the Spanish and Portuguese operations of UB, and rights to all Nabisco
trademarks in the European Union, Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa,
which UB has held since 2000, for a total cost of approximately $1.07 billion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Spanish and Portuguese operations of UB include its biscuits, dry desserts,
canned meats, tomato and fruit juice businesses as well as seven UB
manufacturing facilities and 1,300 employees.&#160;
Together, these businesses generated net revenues of approximately $400
million in 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
acquisition will be financed by the Company&#146;s assumption of approximately $548
million of debt issued by the acquired business immediately prior to the
acquisition, as well as $522 million of value for the redemption of the
Company&#146;s outstanding investment in UB, primarily deep-discount
securities.&#160; The redemption of the
Company&#146;s interest in UB is expected to result in a gain on closing of
approximately $0.13 per diluted share, subject to currency movements and the
finalization of income tax effects.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
transaction is expected to close in the third quarter of 2006, pending
regulatory approval.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes to Condensed
Consolidated Financial Statements</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Rice Sale</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
July 27, 2006, the Company announced that it had agreed to sell its rice brand
and assets for approximately $280 million.&#160;
The transaction, which is subject to regulatory review, is expected to
result in an after-tax gain of approximately $160 million.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt .0001pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Description
of the Company</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. (&#147;Kraft&#148;),
together with its subsidiaries (collectively referred to as the &#147;Company&#148;),
manufactures and markets packaged food products, consisting principally of
beverages, cheese, snacks, convenient meals and various packaged grocery
products.&#160; Kraft manages and reports
operating results through two units, Kraft North America Commercial and Kraft
International Commercial.&#160; Reportable
segments for Kraft North America Commercial are organized and managed
principally by product category.&#160; Kraft
International Commercial&#146;s operations are organized and managed by geographic
location.&#160; At June 30, 2006, Altria
Group, Inc. held 98.4% of the combined voting power of Kraft&#146;s outstanding
capital stock and owned 88.1% of the outstanding shares of Kraft&#146;s capital
stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2005,
the Company announced that, effective January 1, 2006, its Canadian business
will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American
business by product category.&#160; Beginning
in the first quarter of 2006, the operating results of the Canadian business
are being reported throughout the North American food segments.&#160; In addition, in the first quarter of 2006,
the Company&#146;s international businesses were realigned to reflect the
reorganization announced within Europe in November 2005.&#160; The two revised international segments, which
are reflected in this report, are European Union and Developing Markets, Oceania
&amp; North Asia, the latter to reflect the Company&#146;s increased management
focus on developing markets.&#160;
Accordingly, prior period segment results have been restated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the
Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business for pre-tax
proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion.&#160;
The Company has reflected the results of its sugar confectionery
business prior to the closing date as discontinued operations on the condensed
consolidated statements of earnings.&#160; The
Company recorded a loss on sale of discontinued operations of $297 million in
the second quarter of 2005, related largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June 26, 2006,
it was announced that Irene B. Rosenfeld became Chief Executive Officer of the
Company.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As previously
communicated, for significant business reasons, the Altria Group, Inc. Board of
Directors is looking at a number of restructuring alternatives, including the
possibility of separating Kraft from the balance of Altria Group, Inc.&#160; Altria Group, Inc. has indicated that
continuing improvements in its litigation environment are a prerequisite to
such action by its Board of Directors, and the timing and chronology of events
are uncertain.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">29</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\fc\216185435795_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:54 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Executive
Summary</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
executive summary is intended to provide significant highlights of the
Discussion and Analysis that follows.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Operating Results for the Six Months ended June 30, 2006</font></i> &#173;<font face="Symbol">-</font>
The changes in the Company&#146;s earnings and diluted earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;)
from continuing operations for the six months ended June 30, 2006 from the six
months ended June 30, 2005 were due primarily to the following (in millions,
except per share data):</p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="46" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,688</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="46" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.02</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.0pt;">

  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">See discussion of events affecting the
comparability of statement of earnings amounts in the Consolidated Operating
Results section of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
unfavorable net impact of asset impairment, exit and implementation costs on
earnings and diluted EPS from continuing operations is due primarily to the
following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Program </font></i><i><font face="Symbol" style="font-style:italic;">-</font></i><i> </i>The Company announced a three-year restructuring
program in January 2004.&#160; In January
2006, the Company announced plans to expand its restructuring efforts through
2008.&#160; During the six months ended June
30, 2006 and 2005, the Company recorded pre-tax charges of $348 million ($236
million after-tax) and $131 million ($89 million after-tax), respectively, for
the restructuring plan, including pre-tax implementation costs of $30 million
and $45 million, respectively.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Asset Impairment Charges</font></i> &#150; The Company incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $86
million ($63 million after-tax)
in the first quarter of 2006 in recognition of the sale of its pet snacks brand
and assets, which was completed in the third quarter of 2006.&#160; The charge, which includes the write-off of a
portion of the associated goodwill, and intangible and fixed assets, was
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statement of earnings.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition,
during the first quarter of 2006, the Company completed its annual review of
goodwill and intangible assets and recorded non-cash pre-tax charges of $24
million ($15 million after-tax) related to an intangible asset impairment for
biscuits assets in Egypt and hot cereal assets in the United States.&#160; These charges were recorded as asset
impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated statement of earnings.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">30</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\fc\216185435795_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:54 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second quarter of 2005, the Company sold
its fruit snacks assets for approximately $30 million.&#160; The Company incurred a pre-tax asset
impairment charge of $93 million ($60 million after-tax) in the first quarter
of 2005 in recognition of the sale.&#160; The
charge, which includes the write-off of all associated intangible assets, was
recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated
statement of earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For further details on the restructuring program or asset
impairment and implementation costs, see Note 2 to the Condensed Consolidated
Financial Statements and the Business Environment section of the following
Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gains on Sales of Businesses</font></i> &#150; The unfavorable impact on earnings and diluted EPS from continuing
operations is due primarily to the gain on the sale of the U.K. desserts
assets in the first quarter of 2005.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income
Tax Benefit</font></i> - The 2006 tax benefit reflects a reimbursement
from Altria Group, Inc. in cash for unrequired federal tax reserves of $337
million and pre-tax interest of $46 million ($29 million after-tax), as well as
net state tax reversals of $39 million, due to the conclusion of an audit of
Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax returns for the years 1996
through 1999.&#160; Income taxes also include
a benefit of $48 million in 2006 and $56 million in 2005 from the resolution of
outstanding items in the Company&#146;s international operations, and $24 million in
2005 from the settlement of an outstanding U.S. tax claim.&#160; The 2005 income tax rate also includes
benefits from the dividend repatriation provision of the American Jobs Creation
Act.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operations</font></i> - The $129 million increase in results from operations was due
primarily to the following:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher
income in North America Snacks &amp; Cereals, reflecting higher volume/mix,
higher pricing and lower marketing costs, partially offset by higher commodity
costs and increased promotional spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher
income in North America Convenient Meals, reflecting higher pricing, lower
commodity costs and higher volume/mix.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher
income in Developing Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia, reflecting favorable
volume/mix and higher pricing, partially offset by increased marketing
spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher
income in the European Union, reflecting lower general and administrative costs
and favorable volume/mix.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower
interest and other debt expense, reflecting lower debt levels and the
redemption of higher coupon Nabisco bonds, partially offset by higher
short-term interest rates.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Partially offset by:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower
income in North America Beverages, reflecting higher commodity and fixed
manufacturing costs, partially offset by favorable volume/mix and higher
pricing.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For
further details, see the Consolidated Operating Results and Operating Results
by Business Segment sections of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Operating Results for the Three Months ended June 30, 2006</font></i> &#173;<font face="Symbol">-</font>
The changes in the Company&#146;s earnings and diluted earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;)
from continuing operations for the three months ended June 30, 2006 from the
three months ended June 30, 2005 were due primarily to the following (in
millions, except per share data):</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">31</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  </td>
  <td width="53" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="53" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.01</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="478" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:358.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operations</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.2pt;">

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.2pt;">

</div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">See discussion of events affecting the
comparability of statement of earnings amounts in the Consolidated Operating
Results section of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
unfavorable net impact of asset impairment, exit and implementation costs on
earnings and diluted EPS from continuing operations is due primarily to the
following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Program </font></i><i><font face="Symbol" style="font-style:italic;">-</font></i><i> </i>During the three months ended June 30, 2006
and 2005, the Company recorded pre-tax charges of $243 million ($162 million
after-tax) and $55 million ($37 million after-tax), respectively, for the
restructuring plan, including pre-tax implementation costs of $17 million and
$26 million, respectively.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For further details on the restructuring program or asset
impairment and implementation costs, see Note 2 to the Condensed Consolidated
Financial Statements and the Business Environment section of the following
Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Higher
Income Tax Rate</font></i> &#150; The Company&#146;s income tax rate increased by
4.3 percentage points to 33.7%, due primarily to the settlement of an
outstanding U.S. tax claim of $24 million in 2005 and benefits in 2005 from the
dividend repatriation provision of the American Jobs Creation Act.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operations</font></i> - The $93 million increase in results from operations was due
primarily to the following:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher
income in North America Convenient Meals, reflecting higher pricing, lower
commodity costs and higher volume/mix.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher
income in North America Snacks &amp; Cereals, reflecting higher volume/mix,
lower marketing costs and higher pricing, partially offset by higher commodity
costs and increased promotional spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher
income in European Union, reflecting higher pricing and higher volume/mix,
partially offset by increased promotional spending.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher
income in North America Grocery, reflecting favorable volume/mix and higher
pricing, partially offset by higher commodity costs.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">32</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\fc\216185827443_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:58 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Higher income in North America Cheese
&amp; Foodservice, reflecting favorable volume/mix and lower commodity costs,
partially offset by higher marketing costs and increased promotional spending,
net of higher pricing.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lower
interest and other debt expense, reflecting lower debt levels and the redemption
of higher coupon Nabisco bonds, partially offset by higher short-term interest
rates.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">For
further details, see the Consolidated Operating Results and Operating Results
by Business Segment sections of the following Discussion and Analysis.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">2006 Forecasted Results</font></i> &#150; In July 2006, the Company increased its
full-year diluted EPS guidance for 2006 to&#160;
$1.78 to $1.83, or by $0.23 per diluted share, to reflect an anticipated
third quarter $0.13 one-time gain related to Kraft&#146;s redemption of its interest
in United Biscuits, subject to currency movements and the finalization of
income tax effects, and $0.10 in lower asset impairment, exit and
implementation costs.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Guidance now includes
$0.40 per diluted share of charges attributable to the Company&#146;s restructuring
program and other impairment charges (versus $0.50 previously) and a loss of
$0.07 per diluted share for divestiture of the pet snacks business, partially
offset by the anticipated $0.13 per diluted share one-time gain on the
redemption of the Company&#146;s interest in United Biscuits,</font> subject to currency movements and the
finalization of income tax effects, and $0.24 per diluted share for the
favorable resolution of the Altria Group, Inc. 1996-1999 IRS Tax Audit.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
July 27, 2006, the Company announced that it had agreed to sell its rice brand
and assets for approximately $280 million.&#160;
The transaction, which is subject to regulatory review, is expected to
result in an after-tax gain of approximately $160 million ($0.10 per diluted
share).&#160; The gain has not been included
in the guidance amounts above since the sale is subject to regulatory review,
the timing of which cannot currently be estimated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company expects
charges attributable to the restructuring program and other impairment charges
to total approximately $1 billion in 2006 (versus the $1.3 billion estimated
previously) due to the timing of program announcements.&#160; There is no change to the full program.&#160; In addition, there is no change to the
Company&#146;s expectation that cumulative savings will reach approximately $560
million by the end of 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company currently forecasts its 2006 effective income tax rate to average 33%,
excluding charges for asset impairment, exit and implementation costs; and the
impacts of the IRS tax audit resolution.&#160;
The factors described in the &#147;Risk Factors&#148; section of the Company&#146;s
Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2005 and the &#147;Business
Environment&#148; section below represent continuing risks to these forecasts.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Discussion and Analysis</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Business
Environment</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company is subject to a number of challenges that may adversely affect its
businesses.&#160; These challenges, which</font> are discussed below
and under the &#147;Risk Factors&#148; section of
the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K
for the year ended December 31, 2005, include:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>fluctuations
in commodity prices;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>movements
of foreign currencies;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>competitive
challenges in various products and markets, including price gaps with
competitor products and the increasing price-consciousness of consumers;</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">33</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\fc\216185827443_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:58 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
rising cost environment and the limited ability to increase prices;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
trend toward increasing consolidation in the retail trade and consequent
pricing pressure and inventory reductions;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
growing presence of discount retailers, primarily in Europe, with an emphasis
on own-label products;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>changing
consumer preferences, including diet and health/wellness trends;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>competitors
with different profit objectives and less susceptibility to currency exchange
rates; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>concerns
and/or regulations regarding food safety, quality and health, including
genetically modified organisms, trans-fatty acids and obesity.&#160; Increased government regulation of the food
industry could result in increased costs to the Company.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the ordinary course of business, the Company is subject to many
influences that can impact the timing of sales to customers, including the
timing of holidays and other annual or special events, seasonality of certain
products, significant weather conditions, timing of Company or customer
incentive programs and pricing actions, customer inventory programs, Company
initiatives to improve supply chain efficiency, financial condition of
customers and general economic conditions.&#160;
For instance, changes in the timing of the Easter holiday will often
affect first and second quarter comparisons with the prior year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fluctuations in commodity costs can lead to retail price volatility and
intense price competition, and can influence consumer and trade buying
patterns.&#160; During the first six months of
2006, the Company&#146;s commodity costs on average have been higher than those
incurred during the first six months of 2005 (most notably higher coffee,
energy and packaging costs, partially offset by lower cheese and meat costs),
and have adversely affected earnings.&#160;
For the first six months of 2006, the Company&#146;s commodity costs were
approximately $170 million higher than the first six months of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">January</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2004, the Company announced</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">a</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">three-year</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">restructuring</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">program (which is</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">discussed</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">further in</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> </font><font style="let
ter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 2. <i>Asset Impairment, Exit and
Implementation Costs</i>) with the objectives of leveraging the Company&#146;s
global scale, realigning and lowering its cost structure, and optimizing
capacity utilization. I</font>n January
2006, the Company announced plans to expand its restructuring efforts through
2008.&#160; The entire restructuring program
is expected to result in $3.7 billion in pre-tax charges, the closure of up to
40 facilities, the elimination of approximately 14,000 positions and annualized
cost savings at the completion of the program of approximately $1.15
billion.&#160; Approximately $2.3 billion of
the $3.7 billion in pre-tax charges are expected to require cash payments.&#160; P<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">re-tax
restructuring program charges during 2006 are expected to be approximately $1
billion.&#160; </font>Total pre-tax
restructuring program charges incurred were $348 million and $131 million in
the six months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005, respectively, and $243 million and
$55 million in the three months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005, respectively.&#160; Total pre-tax restructuring charges for the
program incurred from January 2004 through June 30, 2006 were $1.3 billion and
specific programs announced will result in the elimination of approximately
8,600 positions.<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Approximately 60% of the pre-tax charges to
date are expected to require cash payments.&#160;
In July 2006, the Company announced that full-year 2006 charges
attributable to the restructuring program and other impairment charges is
estimated to be approximately $1 billion, down from the previous estimate of
$1.3 billion due to the timing of program announcements.&#160; There is no change to the full program.&#160; In addition, there is no change to the
Company&#146;s expectation that cumulative savings will reach approximately $560
million by the end of 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the Company expects to incur
approximately $575 million in capital expenditures to implement the
restructuring program.&#160; From January 2004
through June 30, 2006, the Company spent approximately $166 million in capital,
including $22 million spent in the first six months of 2006, to implement the
restructuring program.&#160; Cumulative
annualized c</font>ost savings
as a result of the restructuring program were approximately $260 million
through 2005, and are anticipated to reach approximately $560 million by the
end of 2006, all of which are expected to be used in support of brand-building
initiatives.&#160; Through June 30, 2006,
cumulative annualized cost savings for the program to date totaled
approximately $385 million.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">34</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\fc\216185827443_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:58 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Acquisitions
and Dispositions:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">One element of the
Company&#146;s growth strategy is to strengthen its brand portfolios and/or expand
its geographic reach through a disciplined program of selective acquisitions
and divestitures.&#160; The Company is
constantly reviewing potential acquisition candidates and from time to time
sells businesses to accelerate the shift in its portfolio toward businesses &#150;
whether global, regional or local &#150; that offer the Company a sustainable
competitive advantage.&#160; The impact of any
future acquisition or divestiture could have a material impact on the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows, and
future sales of businesses could in some cases result in losses on sale.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
July 2006, the Company announced an agreement with United Biscuits (&#147;UB&#148;) to
acquire the Spanish and Portuguese operations of UB and rights to all Nabisco
trademarks in the European Union, Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa,
which UB has held since 2000, for a total cost of approximately $1.07 billion.&#160; The Spanish and Portuguese operations of UB
include its biscuits, dry desserts, canned meats, tomato and fruit juice
businesses as well as seven UB manufacturing facilities and 1,300
employees.&#160; Together, these businesses
generated net revenues of approximately $400 million in 2005.&#160; The acquisition will be financed by the
Company&#146;s assumption of approximately $548 million of debt issued by the
acquired business immediately prior to the acquisition, as well as $522 million
of value for the redemption of the Company&#146;s outstanding investment in UB,
primarily deep-discount securities.&#160; The
redemption of the Company&#146;s interest in UB is expected to result in a gain on
closing of approximately $0.13 per diluted share, subject to currency movements
and the finalization of income tax effects.&#160;
The transaction is expected to close in the third quarter of 2006,
pending regulatory approval.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As previously
discussed, the Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery
business in June 2005 for pre-tax proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion.&#160; The sale included the <i>Life Savers</i>,
<i>Creme Savers</i>, <i>Altoids</i>,
<i>Trolli</i> and <i>Sugus</i>
brands.&#160; The Company has reflected the
results of its sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as
discontinued operations on the condensed consolidated statements of
earnings.&#160; The Company recorded a loss on
sale of discontinued operations of $297 million in the second quarter of 2005,
related largely to taxes on the transaction.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second
quarter of 2006, the Company sold its industrial coconut assets.&#160; During the first quarter of 2006, the Company
sold certain Canadian assets and a small U.S. biscuit brand and incurred
pre-tax asset impairment charges of $176 million in the fourth quarter of 2005
in recognition of these sales.&#160; During
the second quarter of 2005, the Company sold its fruit snacks assets, and
incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $93 million in the first quarter
of 2005 in recognition of this sale.&#160;
During the first quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts
assets, its U.S. yogurt assets and a minor trademark in Mexico.&#160; The aggregate proceeds received from these
sales during the first six months of 2006 and 2005 were $91 million and $221
million, respectively, on which pre-tax losses of $11 million and pre-tax gains
of $115 million, respectively, were recorded.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July 2006, the
Company completed the sale of its pet snacks brand and assets for $580 million
and recorded additional taxes of approximately $60 million related to the
sale.&#160; This sale and the additional taxes
were recorded in the third quarter of 2006.&#160;
In the first quarter of 2006, the Company incurred a pre-tax asset
impairment charge of $86 million in recognition of this sale.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The operating
results of the businesses sold, excluding the sugar confectionery business, in
the aggregate, were not material to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial
position, results of operations or cash flows in any of the periods presented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">35</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\fc\216185827443_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:58 2006' -->

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating
  income:</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="77" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:57.8pt;">

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">36</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\fc\216185827443_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:58 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Consolidated
Operating Results</font></u></b></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="76" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:56.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">472</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following events occurred during the first six months and second
quarter of 2006 and 2005 that affected the comparability of statement of
earnings amounts:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font> <i>Income Tax Benefits </i>&#151; In the first quarter of 2006, the United
States Internal Revenue Service concluded its examination of Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s
consolidated tax returns for the years 1996 through 1999 and issued a final
Revenue Agents Report on March 15, 2006.&#160;&#160;
Consequently, Altria Group, Inc. reimbursed the Company in cash for
unrequired federal tax reserves of $337 million and pre-tax interest of $46
million ($29 million after-tax).&#160; The
Company also recognized net state tax reversals of $39 million, resulting in a
total net earnings benefit of $405 million or $0.24 per diluted share, in the
first quarter of 2006.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font> <i>Asset
impairment, exit and implementation costs </i>&#151; As discussed in Note 2
to the condensed consolidated financial statements, during the six months and
three months ended June 30, 2006, the Company recorded $428 million and $226
million, respectively, of pre-tax asset impairment and exit costs on its
condensed consolidated statements of earnings.&#160;
During the six months and three months ended June 30, 2005, the Company
recorded $179 million and $29 million, respectively, of pre-tax asset
impairment and exit costs on its condensed consolidated statements of
earnings.&#160; Additionally, during the six
months and three months ended June 30, 2006, the Company recorded pre-tax
implementation costs of $30 million and $17 million, respectively.&#160; During the six months and three months ended
June 30, 2005, the Company recorded pre-tax implementation costs of $45 million
and $26 million, respectively.&#160; The
pre-tax asset impairment, exit and implementation costs were included in the
operating companies income of the following segments:</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">37</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  <td width="10%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.96%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Implementation<br>
  Costs</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:.98%;">

  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.98%;">

  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:.98%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:.98%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">55</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font> <i>Losses/Gains on Sales of Businesses &#150;</i> During the second quarter of 2006, the
Company sold its industrial coconut assets and recorded a pre-tax loss of $8
million.&#160; This loss is included in the
operating companies income of the North America Cheese &amp; Foodservice segment.&#160; During the first quarter of 2006, the Company
sold certain Canadian assets and recorded a pre-tax loss of $1
million.&#160; This loss is included in the
operating companies income of the North America Grocery segment.&#160; In
addition, the Company sold a small U.S. biscuit brand in the first quarter of
2006, resulting in a pre-tax loss of $2 million.&#160; This loss is included in the operating
companies income of the North America Snacks &amp; Cereals segment.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the second
quarter of 2005, the Company sold its fruit snacks assets and recorded a
pre-tax loss of $2 million.&#160; This loss is
included in the operating companies income of the North America Grocery
segment.&#160; Also in the second quarter of
2005, the Company recorded a pre-tax gain of $1 million from the sale of its
U.S. yogurt assets.&#160; This gain is
included in the operating companies income of the North America Cheese &amp;
Foodservice segment.&#160; During the first
quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts assets and recorded a pre-tax
gain of $115 million.&#160; This gain is
included in the operating companies income of the European Union segment.&#160; In addition, the Company sold a minor
trademark in Mexico, resulting in a pre-tax gain of $1 million.&#160; This gain is included in the operating
companies income of the Developing Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia segment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">39</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\fc\216185827443_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:58 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 22.5pt;text-indent:-22.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font> <i>Discontinued
Operations &#150;</i> As more fully discussed in Note 4. <i>Divestitures</i>,
in June 2005, the Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery
business.&#160; The Company has reflected the
results of its sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as
discontinued operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings
for all periods presented.&#160; The Company
recorded a loss on sale of discontinued operations of $297 million in the
second quarter of 2005, related largely to taxes on the transaction.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in Note 9. <i>Segment Reporting</i>,
the Company&#146;s management uses operating companies income, which is defined as
operating income before general corporate expenses and amortization of
intangibles, to evaluate segment performance and allocate resources.&#160; Management believes it is appropriate to
disclose this measure to help investors analyze the business performance and
trends of the various business segments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated
Results of Operations for the Six Months Ended June 30, 2006</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following discussion
compares consolidated operating results for the six months ended June 30, 2006
with the six months ended June 30, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Volume decreased 3.0%,
due primarily to the impact of divestitures.&#160;
Excluding the impact of divestitures, volume was essentially unchanged,
due primarily to the discontinuation of certain ready-to-drink product lines in
North America (primarily beverages in Canada) and lower shipments of coffee in
the European Union, offset by increased shipments of meats, snacks and cheese
in North America.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
revenues increased $349 million (2.1%), due primarily to favorable volume/mix
($526 million) and higher net pricing ($163 million, reflecting
commodity-driven pricing, partially offset by increased promotional spending),
partially offset by the impact of divested businesses ($214 million) and
unfavorable currency ($127 million, primarily in the European Union).</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating income
decreased $212 million (8.8%)</font>, due primarily to higher pre-tax asset impairment and exit costs ($249
million), 2005 net gains on the sales of businesses ($115 million), 2006 losses
on the sales of businesses ($11 million), unfavorable currency ($6 million),
the impact of divestitures ($6 million), higher costs, net of pricing ($6
million), higher marketing, administration and research costs ($5 million) and
higher fixed manufacturing costs ($5 million), partially offset by favorable
volume/mix ($176 million) and lower implementation costs ($15 million).</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Currency movements
decreased net revenues by $127 million and operating income by $6 million.&#160; These decreases were due primarily to the
strength of the U.S. dollar against the euro, partially offset by the weakness
of the U.S. dollar against the Canadian dollar and the Brazilian real.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest and other
debt expense, net, decreased $107 million (30.6%) due primarily to $46 million
of pre-tax interest income associated with the conclusion of a tax audit at
Altria Group, Inc., lower debt levels and the redemption of higher coupon
Nabisco bonds, partially offset by higher short-term interest rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s income tax rate decreased by 15.7 percentage points to 13.4%.&#160; The 2006 tax rate includes a reimbursement
from Altria Group, Inc. in cash for unrequired federal tax reserves of $337
million and net state tax reversals of $39 million, due to the conclusion of an
audit of Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax returns for the
years 1996 through 1999.&#160; Income taxes
also include a benefit of $48 million in 2006 and $56 million in 2005 from the
resolution of outstanding items in the Company&#146;s international operations, and
$24 million in 2005 from the settlement of an outstanding U.S. tax claim.&#160; The 2005 income tax rate also includes
benefits from the dividend repatriation provision of the American Jobs Creation
Act.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">40</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='40',FILE='C:\fc\216185827443_D11113_1277872\15579-1-dy.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 18:58 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Earnings from continuing operations of $1,688 million increased $231
million (15.9%), due primarily to the tax benefit discussed above and lower
interest expense, partially offset by lower operating income (reflecting higher
asset impairment and exit costs in 2006).&#160;
Diluted EPS from continuing operations, which was $1.02, increased by
18.6%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The loss from discontinued operations, net of income taxes, in 2005 was
due primarily to the recording of additional tax expense of $297 million that
arose from the sale of the sugar confectionery business in the second quarter
of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net earnings of $1,688 million increased $503 million (42.4%).&#160; Diluted EPS from net earnings, which was
$1.02, increased by 45.7%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Results of Operations for the Three
Months Ended June 30, 2006</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following discussion compares consolidated operating results for the three
months ended June 30, 2006 with the three months ended June 30, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Volume
decreased 1.7%, due primarily to the impact of divestitures.&#160; Excluding the impact of divestitures, volume
increased 0.9%, due to higher shipments across all segments except North
America Beverages due to the discontinuation of certain ready-to-drink product
lines (primarily in Canada) and essentially flat shipments in Developing Markets,
Oceania &amp; North Asia.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues increased $285 million (3.4%), due primarily to favorable
volume/mix ($374 million) and higher net pricing ($31 million, reflecting
commodity-driven pricing, partially offset by increased promotional spending),
partially offset by the impact of divested businesses ($89 million) and
unfavorable currency ($32 million, primarily in the European Union).</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating
income decreased $73 million (5.8%)</font>, due primarily to higher pre-tax asset impairment and exit costs ($197
million), higher marketing, administration and research costs ($23 million),
2006 losses on the sales of businesses ($8 million), partially offset by
favorable volume/mix ($144 million), lower implementation costs ($9 million)
and favorable fixed manufacturing costs.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Currency movements decreased net revenues by $32 million and increased
operating income by $1 million.&#160; The
currency movements were due primarily to the strength of the U.S. dollar
against the euro, partially offset by the weakness of the U.S. dollar against
the Canadian dollar and the Brazilian real.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest and other debt expense, net, decreased $27
million (15.5%) due primarily to lower debt levels and the redemption of higher
coupon Nabisco bonds, partially offset by higher short-term interest rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s reported income tax rate increased by 4.3 percentage points to 33.7%,
due primarily to the settlement of an outstanding U.S. tax claim of $24 million
in 2005 and benefits in 2005 from the dividend repatriation provision of the
American Jobs Creation Act.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Earnings from continuing operations of $682 million decreased $76
million (10.0%), due primarily to lower operating income (reflecting higher
asset impairment and exit costs in 2006) and a higher income tax rate,
partially offset by lower interest expense.&#160;
Diluted EPS from continuing operations, which was $0.41, decreased by
8.9%.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">41</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\fc\216190393_D11113_1277872\15579-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 19:00 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The loss from discontinued operations, net of income taxes, in 2005 was
due primarily to the recording of additional tax expense of $297 million that
arose from the sale of the sugar confectionery business in the second quarter
of 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net earnings of $682 million increased $210 million (44.5%).&#160; Diluted EPS from net earnings, which was
$0.41, increased by 46.4%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Operating Results by Business Segment&#160; </font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following discussion compares operating results within each of Kraft&#146;s
reportable segments for the six months ended June 30, 2006 with the six months
ended June 30, 2005.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;">
