 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="173" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:129.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Multi-year</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="51" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="173" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="51" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="51" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="51" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="2" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s revolving credit facility, which is for its sole use, requires the
maintenance of a minimum net worth of $20.0 billion.&#160; At June 30, 2006, the Company&#146;s net worth was
$30.4 billion.&#160; The Company expects to
continue to meet this covenant.&#160; The
revolving credit facility does not include any other financial tests, any
credit rating triggers or any provisions that could require the posting of
collateral.&#160; </font>The Company expects to refinance long-term
and short-term debt from time to time.&#160;
The nature and amount of the Company&#146;s long-term and short-term debt and
the proportionate amount of each can be expected to vary as a result of future
business requirements, market conditions and other factors.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition to the above, certain international subsidiaries of Kraft maintain
credit lines to meet the short-term working capital needs of the international
businesses.&#160; These credit lines, which
amounted to approximately $1.3 billion as of June 30, 2006, are for the sole
use of the Company&#146;s international businesses.&#160;
At June 30, 2006, borrowings on these lines amounted to approximately
$185 million.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Guarantees.</font></i>&#160; As discussed in Note 7. <i>Contingencies</i>, the Company had third-party guarantees,
which are primarily derived from acquisition and divestiture activities, of
approximately $24 million at June 30, 2006.&#160;
Substantially all of these guarantees expire through 2013, with $12
million expiring through June 30, 2007.&#160;
The Company is required to perform under these guarantees in the event
that a third party fails to make contractual payments or achieve performance
measures.&#160; The Company has a liability of
$16 million on its condensed consolidated balance sheet at June 30, 2006,
relating to these guarantees.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, at June 30, 2006, the Company was contingently liable for
$147 million of guarantees related to its own performance.&#160; These include surety bonds related to dairy
commodity purchases and guarantees related to the payment of custom duties and
taxes, and letters of credit.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">50</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='50',FILE='C:\fc\216190393_D11113_1277872\15579-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 19:00 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Guarantees do not
have, and are not expected to have, a significant impact on the Company&#146;s
liquidity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company believes that its cash from operations and
existing credit facility will provide sufficient liquidity to meet its working
capital needs (including the cash requirements of the restructuring program),
planned capital expenditures, future contractual obligations and payment of its
anticipated quarterly dividends.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Equity
and Dividends</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
December 2004, the Company commenced repurchasing shares under a two-year $1.5
billion Class A common stock repurchase program authorized by its Board of
Directors.&#160; In March 2006, the Company
completed the program, acquiring 49.1 million Class A shares at an average
price of $30.57 per share.&#160; In March
2006, the Company&#146;s Board of Directors authorized a new share repurchase
program to repurchase up to $2.0 billion of the Company&#146;s Class A common
stock.&#160; This new program is expected to
run through 2008.&#160; During the first six
months of 2006 and 2005, the Company repurchased 8.5 million and 12.3 million
shares, respectively, of its Class A common stock under its $1.5 billion
repurchase program at a cost of $250 million and $400 million,
respectively.&#160; In addition, as of June
30, 2006, the Company repurchased 12.0 million shares of its Class A common
stock, under its new $2.0 billion authority, at an aggregate cost of $375
million, bringing total repurchases for the first six months of 2006 to 20.5
million shares for $625 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in Note 5. <i>Stock Plans</i>,
during the first quarter of 2006, the Company granted approximately 4.4 million
restricted Class A shares to eligible U.S.-based employees and also issued to
eligible non-U.S. employees rights to receive approximately 2.0 million Class A
equivalent shares.&#160; Restrictions on the
stock and rights lapse in the first quarter of 2009.&#160; The market value per restricted share or
right was $29.00 on the date of grant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dividends
paid in the first six months of 2006 and 2005 were $769 million and $700
million, respectively, an increase of 9.9%, reflecting a higher dividend rate
in 2006, partially offset by a lower number of shares outstanding as a result
of Class A share repurchases.&#160; The
present annualized dividend rate is $0.92 per common share.&#160; The declaration of dividends is subject to
the discretion of Kraft&#146;s Board of Directors and will depend on various
factors, including the Company&#146;s net earnings, financial condition, cash
requirements, future prospects and other factors deemed relevant by Kraft&#146;s
Board of Directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Market
Risk</font></u></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company operates
globally, with manufacturing and sales facilities in various locations around
the world, and utilizes certain financial instruments to manage its foreign
currency and commodity exposures.&#160;
Derivative financial instruments are used by the Company, principally to
reduce exposure to market risks resulting from fluctuations in foreign exchange
rates and commodity prices by creating offsetting exposures.&#160; The Company is not a party to leveraged
derivatives and, by policy, does not use financial instruments for speculative
purposes.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the six months and
three months ended June 30, 2006 and 2005, ineffectiveness related to cash flow
hedges was not material.&#160; At June 30,
2006, the Company was hedging forecasted transactions for periods not exceeding
the next eighteen months and expects substantially all amounts reported in
accumulated other comprehensive earnings (losses) to be reclassified to the
consolidated statement of earnings within the next twelve months.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Foreign exchange rates</font></i>.&#160; The Company uses forward foreign exchange
contracts and foreign currency options to mitigate its exposure to changes in
exchange rates from third-party and intercompany actual and forecasted
transactions.&#160; Substantially all of the
Company&#146;s derivative financial instruments are effective as hedges.&#160; The primary currencies to which the Company
is exposed, based on the size and location of its businesses, include the euro,
Swiss franc, British pound and Canadian dollar.&#160;
At June 30, 2006 and December 31, 2005, the Company had foreign exchange
option and forward contracts with aggregate notional amounts of $2.5 billion
and $2.2 billion, respectively.&#160; The
effective portion of unrealized gains and losses associated with forward and
option contracts is deferred as a component of accumulated other comprehensive
earnings (losses) until the underlying hedged transactions are reported on the
Company&#146;s consolidated statement of earnings.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">51</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='51',FILE='C:\fc\216190393_D11113_1277872\15579-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 19:00 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Commodities</font></i>.&#160; The Company is exposed to price risk related
to forecasted purchases of certain commodities used as raw materials by its
businesses.&#160; Accordingly, the Company
uses commodity forward contracts as cash flow hedges, primarily for coffee,
milk, sugar and cocoa.&#160; Commodity futures
and options are also used to hedge the price of certain commodities, including
milk, coffee, cocoa, wheat, corn, sugar and soybean oil.&#160; In general, commodity forward contracts
qualify for the normal purchase exception under Statement of Financial
Accounting Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;) No. 133 and are, therefore, not subject to the
provisions of SFAS No. 133.&#160; At June 30,
2006 and December 31, 2005, the Company had net long commodity positions of
$393 million and $521 million, respectively.&#160;
Unrealized gains or losses on net commodity positions were immaterial at
June 30, 2006 and December 31, 2005.&#160; The
effective portion of unrealized gains and losses on commodity futures and
option contracts is deferred as a component of accumulated other comprehensive
earnings (losses) and is recognized as a component of cost of sales in the
Company&#146;s consolidated statement of earnings when the related inventory is
sold.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">New Accounting Standards</font></u></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See Notes 1 and 12 to the
Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for a discussion of new accounting
standards.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Contingencies</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See Note 7. <i>Contingencies</i> and Part II &#150; Other Information, Item 1. Legal
Proceedings for a discussion of contingencies.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">52</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='52',FILE='C:\fc\216190393_D11113_1277872\15579-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 19:00 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward-Looking
Statements</font></u>  </b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company and its
representatives may from time to time make written or oral forward-looking
statements, including statements contained in the Company&#146;s filings with the
SEC, in its reports to shareholders and in press releases and investor
webcasts.&#160; One can identify these
forward-looking statements by use of words such as &#147;strategy,&#148; &#147;expects,&#148; &#147;plans,&#148;
&#147;anticipates,&#148; &#147;believes,&#148; &#147;will,&#148; &#147;continues,&#148; &#147;estimates,&#148; &#147;intends,&#148; &#147;projects,&#148;
&#147;goals,&#148; &#147;targets&#148; and other words of similar meaning.&#160; One can also identify them by the fact that
they do not relate strictly to historical or current facts.&#160; The Company cannot guarantee that any
forward-looking statement will be realized, although it believes that it has
been prudent in its plans and assumptions.&#160;
Achievement of future results is subject to risks, uncertainties, and
the possibility of inaccurate assumptions.&#160;
Should known or unknown risks or uncertainties materialize, or should
underlying assumptions prove inaccurate, actual results could vary materially
from those anticipated, estimated, or projected.&#160; Investors should bear this in mind as they
consider forward-looking statements and whether to invest in or remain invested
in the Company&#146;s securities.&#160; In
connection with the &#145;&#145;safe harbor&#146;&#146; provisions of the Private Securities
Litigation Reform Act of 1995, the Company identifies from time to time
important factors that could cause actual results and outcomes to differ
materially from those contained in any forward-looking statement made by or on
behalf of the Company.&#160; These factors
include the ones discussed in the &#147;Risk Factors&#148; section of the Company&#146;s
Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2005 and the &#147;Business
Environment&#148; section in this report preceding the discussion of operating
results, as well as other factors discussed in filings made by the Company with
the SEC.&#160; It is not possible to predict
or identify all risk factors.&#160;
Consequently, the risk factors discussed in this document should not be
considered a complete discussion of all potential risks or uncertainties.&#160; The Company does not undertake to update any
forward-looking statement that it may make from time to time.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">53</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='53',FILE='C:\fc\216190393_D11113_1277872\15579-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 19:00 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 4.&#160; Controls and Procedures.&#160; <a name="Item4_ControlsAndProcedures__160527"></a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company carried out
an evaluation, with the participation of the Company&#146;s management, including
the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, of the
effectiveness of the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures (pursuant to
Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended) as
of the end of the period covered by this report. Based upon that evaluation,
the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that the
Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures are effective.&#160; Our management evaluated, with the
participation of the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial
Officer, any change in the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting
and determined that there has been no change in the Company&#146;s internal control
over financial reporting during the quarter ended June 30, 2006 that has
materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">54</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='54',FILE='C:\fc\216190393_D11113_1277872\15579-1-ea.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 19:00 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART II - OTHER
INFORMATION<a name="PartIiOtherInformation_161030"></a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 25.2pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Legal Proceedings.<a name="Item1_LegalProceedings__161033"></a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.5pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is party to a variety of legal proceedings
arising out of the normal course of business, including the matters discussed
below. While the results of litigation cannot be predicted with certainty,
management believes that the final outcome of these proceedings will not have a
material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position,
results of operations or cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2002, Mr. Mustapha Gaouar and five other family members
(collectively &#147;the Gaouars&#148;) filed suit in the Commercial Court of Casablanca
against Kraft Foods Maroc and Mr. Omar Berrada claiming damages of
approximately $31 million arising from a non-compete undertaking signed by Mr.
Gaouar allegedly under duress.&#160; The
non-compete clause was contained in an agreement concluded in 1986 between Mr.
Gaouar and Mr. Berrada acting for himself and for his group of companies,
including Les Cafes Ennasr (renamed Kraft Foods Maroc), which was acquired by
Kraft Foods International, Inc. from Mr. Berrada in 2001.&#160; In June 2003, the court issued a preliminary
judgment against Kraft Foods Maroc and Mr. Berrada holding that the Gaouars are
entitled to damages for being deprived of the possibility of engaging in coffee
roasting from 1986 due to such non-compete undertaking.&#160; At that time, the court appointed two experts
to assess the amount of damages to be awarded.&#160;
In December 2003, these experts delivered a report concluding that they
could see no evidence of loss suffered by the Gaouars.&#160; The Gaouars asked the court that this report
be set aside and new court experts be appointed.&#160; On April 15, 2004, the court delivered a
judgment upholding the defenses of Kraft Foods Maroc and rejecting the claims
of the Gaouars.&#160; The Gaouars appealed
this judgment, and in July 2005, the Court of Appeal gave judgment in favor of
Kraft Foods Maroc confirming the decision rendered by the Commercial
Court.&#160; On November 29, 2005, the Gaouars
filed their further appeal to the Moroccan Supreme Court.&#160; A court hearing has not been scheduled yet.
Mr. Berrada did not disclose the existence of the claims of Mr. Gaouar at the
time of the Kraft Foods International, Inc. acquisition of Kraft Foods Maroc in
2001.&#160; As a result, in the event that the
Company is ultimately found liable on appeal for damages to plaintiff in this
case, the Company believes that it may have claims against Mr. Berrada for
recovery of all or a portion of the amount.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March 2004, Kraft Foods
France joined other EU based coffee manufacturers in a proceeding before the
European Patent Office (&#147;EPO&#148;) to challenge the validity of a Sara Lee/Douwe
Egbert&#146;s (&#147;SL/DE&#148;) European Patent entitled &#147;Assembly for use in a coffee
machine for preparing coffee, container and pouch of said assembly&#148; (the &#147;Patent&#148;).&nbsp;
This patent relates to a specific brew basket and coffee pods (or pouches) made
from filter paper (&#147;coffee pods&#148;, for short) and the assembly of these
elements; it does not concern, for example, coffee in plastic disks for use in
hot-beverage systems.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Germany
intervened in the EPO proceeding in November 2004.</font>&nbsp; </font>In January 2005, the EPO issued a decision
that narrowed the Patent while upholding especially the assembly as
valid.&nbsp; All parties appealed and a hearing is scheduled to take place on
August 29 and 30, 2006.&nbsp; If upheld, the validity of the patent will remain
subject to challenge on a country-by-country basis.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is involved in
two other proceedings related to an asserted infringement of the Patent.&nbsp; First,<i> </i>in
February 2004 Kraft Foods France filed a suit before the Paris Court of First
Instance seeking a declaration that its coffee pods do not infringe the French
part of the Patent. SL/DE replied that the Company&#146;s sale of its coffee pods in
France (and, as discussed below, in Germany) for use in Philips&#146; &#147;Senseo&#148;
coffee pod machines &#147;contributorily&#148; infringe the Patent.</font>&#160; </font>The
trial is scheduled for January 15, 2007.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">55</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='55',FILE='C:\fc\2161929598_D11113_1277872\15579-1-ec.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 19:02 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Second,
</font>in September 2004 SL/DE
started patent infringement proceedings in the D&#252;sseldorf court against Kraft
Foods Germany.&#160; In September 2005, a
court of first instance in D&#252;sseldorf prohibited Kraft Foods Germany from
selling coffee pods in Germany.&nbsp; Kraft Foods Germany appealed and a
hearing is scheduled for March 22, 2007.&nbsp; Currently, the Company is not
selling coffee pods in Germany but may decide to resume such sales in the
future in light of developments in regard to the Patent.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 40.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is vigorously
pursuing all proceedings related to the Patent but cannot predict the ultimate
outcome.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">56</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='56',FILE='C:\fc\2161929598_D11113_1277872\15579-1-ec.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Aug  4 19:02 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 1A.&#160;&#160; Risk Factors.<a name="Item1a_RiskFactors__170808"></a></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">There were no material changes to the Risk Factors disclosed in the
Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form</font>  </font>10-K for the year ended
December 31, 2005.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Unregistered Sales of Equity Securities
and Use of Proceeds.<a name="Item2_UnregisteredSalesOfEquitySe_170811"></a></font></p>

share repurchase activity for each of the three months ended June 30, 2006 was

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="27%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:15.7%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In March 2006, the
Company&#146;s Board of Directors approved a share repurchase program of up to $2.0
billion of its Class A common stock.&#160; All
share repurchases have been made pursuant to this program.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Aggregate number of
shares repurchased under the share repurchase program as of the end of the
period presented.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Shares tendered to
the Company by employees who vested in restricted stock and rights, and used
shares to pay the related taxes.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">57</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Agreement Relating to United Biscuits Southern
  Europe, dated as of July 8, 2006. (3)</font></p>

<body lang="EN-US">

<div>

<p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exhibit 10.25</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CONFIDENTIAL MATERIAL APPEARING IN THIS DOCUMENT HAS BEEN OMITTED AND
FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION IN ACCORDANCE WITH
RULE 406 PROMULGATED UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1934, AS AMENDED, AND RULE
24B-2 PROMULGATED THEREUNDER.&#160; OMITTED
INFORMATION HAS BEEN REPLACED WITH ASTERISKS.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">MASTER PROFESSIONAL SERVICES AGREEMENT</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AMONG</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">KRAFT FOODS GLOBAL, INC.,</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">EDS INFORMATION SERVICES, L.L.C.,</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AND</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ELECTRONIC
DATA SYSTEMS CORPORATION</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">KRAFT / EDS CONFIDENTIAL</font></b></p>

<br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-01.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:12 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">MASTER PROFESSIONAL SERVICES AGREEMENT</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This Master Professional Services Agreement (this &#147;<b>Agreement</b>&#148;) is entered into effective April 27, 2006 (the &#147;<b>Effective Date</b>&#148;) by and between Kraft Foods Global, Inc., a
Delaware corporation having a principal place of business at Three Lakes Drive,
Northfield, Illinois 60093 (&#147;<b>Kraft</b>&#148;), and<b><i style="font-weight:bold;"> </i></b>EDS Information Services, L.L.C. (&#147;<b>EIS</b>&#148;), a<b><i style="font-weight:bold;"> </i></b>Delaware
limited liability company<b><i style="font-weight:bold;"> </i></b>and
Electronic Data Systems Corporation (&#147;<b>EDS</b>&#148;),<b><i style="font-weight:bold;"> </i></b>a Delaware corporation, each having
a principal place of business at 5400 Legacy Drive, Plano, Texas 75024 (EIS and
EDS are collectively referred to herein as the &#147;<b>Supplier</b>&#148;).</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">WHEREAS, Kraft and Supplier have engaged in extensive
negotiations, discussions and due diligence that have culminated in the
formation of the contractual relationship described in this Agreement; and</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">WHEREAS, Kraft desires to procure from Supplier, and
Supplier desires to provide to Kraft and the Eligible Recipients, the
information technology and other products and services described in this
Agreement, on the terms and conditions specified herein;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises
and covenants contained herein, and of other good and valid consideration, the
receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, Kraft and Supplier
(collectively, the &#147;<b>Parties</b>&#148; and
each, a &#147;<b>Party</b>&#148;) hereby agree as follows:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>BACKGROUND
AND OBJECTIVES</b><a name="a1_BackgroundAndObjectives_132208"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Performance
and Management by Supplier.</b><a name="a1_1PerformanceAndManagementBySup_132210"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft desires that certain information technology and
other functions and services presently performed and managed by or for Kraft
and the Eligible Recipients, as each is described in this Agreement, be
performed and managed by Supplier. Supplier has carefully reviewed Kraft&#146;s
requirements, has performed all due diligence it deems necessary, and desires
to perform and manage such information technology and other business processes
and services for Kraft and the Eligible Recipients.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Goals
and Objectives.</b><a name="a1_2GoalsAndObjectives__132212"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Parties acknowledge and agree that the specific
goals and objectives of the Parties in entering into this Agreement are to:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Reduce
Kraft infrastructure capital and operating expenses, both initially and over
the Term of this Agreement, in accordance with this Agreement;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Utilize
enabling technologies to add value to Kraft&#146;s business processes;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Continue
to deliver year-on-year cost reductions;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Design
new capabilities and innovations to enable growth;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Implement
common processes and move toward an integrated enterprise-wide reporting system
across Kraft;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Provide
committed levels of service quality that are consistent and harmonized across
differentiating or core processes;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Enhance
the morale and career opportunities of displaced employees by transitioning
Kraft information technology personnel to positions of opportunity with a
first-tier provider of information technology services;</p>


 <p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-01.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:12 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(8)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Gain
access to world class capabilities by contracting with a first tier Supplier
that can attract the &#147;best and brightest&#148; individuals;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(9)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Enhance
the ability of Kraft and its affiliated companies to focus on their core
businesses;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(10)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Provide
Kraft with a service structure that will enhance its ability to quickly and
effectively adapt to changing business requirements and changes in the Kraft
business environment;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(11)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Standardize
and reduce complexity in similar processes, taking into account relative
advantages of cost and functionality;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(12)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Institutionalize
ongoing governance to ensure a new way of working is maintained with continuous
improvement opportunities;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(13)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Create
the potential for sustainable long-term cost savings due to continuous
improvement and reduction or spreading of fixed costs over a multi-year period;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(14)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Enhance
Kraft&#146;s ability to manage its business to predictable costs;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(15)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Provide
a contract structure that will minimize the occurrence of true-ups after the
Effective Date that would result in unplanned changes in the Services, Service
performance, pricing or to other costs to Kraft;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(16)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Leverage
the Supplier&#146;s scale in the procurement of goods and services associated with
the agreement;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(17)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Minimize
and/or eliminate Third Party Contract breakage penalties and costs;</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(18)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Provide
the information required to support Kraft&#146;s internal chargeback and support
Kraft&#146;s management of individual services and cost; and</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(19)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Obtain
access to best practices in the area of information technology business
processes and services.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Interpretation.</b><a name="a1_3Interpretation__132218"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The provisions of this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 1</u></b>
are intended to be a general introduction to this Agreement and are not
intended to expand the scope of the Parties&#146; obligations or alter the plain
meaning of this Agreement&#146;s terms and conditions, as set forth hereinafter.
However, to the extent the terms and conditions of this Agreement are unclear
or ambiguous, such terms and conditions are to be construed so as to be
consistent with the background and objectives set forth in this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>DEFINITIONS
AND DOCUMENTS</b><a name="a2_DefinitionsAndDocuments_132220"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Definitions.</b><a name="a2_1Definitions__132223"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The terms used with initial capital letters in this
Agreement shall have the meanings ascribed to them in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
1</u></b>.</font></p>


 <p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-01.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:12 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Other
Terms.</b><a name="a2_2OtherTerms__132226"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The terms defined in this Article include the plural
as well as the singular and the derivatives of such terms. Unless otherwise
expressly stated, the words &#147;<b>herein</b>,&#148; &#147;<b>hereof</b>,&#148; and &#147;<b>hereunder</b>&#148; and
other words of similar import refer to this Agreement as a whole and not to any
particular Article, Section, Subsection or other subdivision. Article, Section
and Subsection references refer to articles, sections and subsections of this
Agreement. The words &#147;<b>include</b>&#148; and &#147;<b>including</b>&#148; shall not be construed as terms of limitation.
The words &#147;<b>day</b>,&#148; &#147;<b>month</b>,&#148;
and &#147;<b>year</b>&#148; mean, respectively, calendar day,
calendar month and calendar year. As stated in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
21.3</u></b>, the word &#147;<b>notice</b>&#148; and &#147;<b>notification</b>&#148; and their derivatives shall mean notice or notification
in writing. Other terms used in this Agreement are defined in the context in
which they are used and shall have the meanings there indicated.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Companion
Agreements.</b><a name="a2_3CompanionAgreements__132228"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.3.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Operation.
</b>The Parties will enter into one or more companion agreements to this
Agreement between Eligible Recipients outside of the United States and
corresponding Supplier Affiliates in those same countries for the purpose of
memorializing the implementation of this Agreement with respect to such
Eligible Recipients, compliance with Laws applicable to such Eligible
Recipients or otherwise to effect the intent of the Parties under this
Agreement with respect to such Eligible Recipients (each, a &#147;<b>Companion Agreement</b>&#148;). All references to this Agreement
include all Companion Agreements. Each Companion Agreement will be in form of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Exhibit 1</u></b>, unless otherwise agreed
by the Parties. Kraft and Supplier agree that the execution of Companion
Agreements shall in no way limit or reduce the obligations of either Party
under this Agreement, including with respect to the provision of Services to
any Eligible Recipient, except (i) for provisions in a particular Companion
Agreement that are expressly acknowledged to be an amendment to this Agreement
for purposes of such Companion Agreement, or (ii) as required by applicable
local law.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.3.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Enforcement.
</b>Kraft and Supplier acknowledge and agree that with respect to each
Companion Agreement, Kraft shall be fully responsible and liable for all
obligations of the applicable Eligible Recipient, and Supplier shall be fully
responsible and liable for all obligations of itself or any Supplier Affiliate
or Subcontractor, as may be applicable. Kraft shall have the right to enforce
this Agreement (including the terms of all Companion Agreements) on behalf of
each Eligible Recipient that enters into a Companion Agreement, and to assert
all rights and exercise and receive the benefits of all remedies (including
monetary damages) of each such Eligible Recipient, to the same extent as if
Kraft were such Eligible Recipient, subject to the limitations of liability
applicable under this Agreement. Supplier shall have the right to enforce this
Agreement (including the terms of all Companion Agreements) on behalf of each
Affiliate or Subcontractor that enters into a Companion Agreement, and to
assert all rights and exercise and receive the benefits of all remedies
(including monetary damages) of each such Affiliate or Subcontractor hereunder,
to the same extent as if Supplier were such Affiliate or Subcontractor, subject
to the limitations of liability applicable under this Agreement.
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any Companion Agreement, any and
all disputes arising under or relating to any Companion Agreement shall be
subject to the provisions of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 19</u></b>,
and under no circumstances shall Kraft or any Eligible Recipient, on the one
hand, or Supplier or any Supplier Affiliate or Subcontractor, on the other
hand, bring or attempt to bring any claim or other action arising under or
relating to any Companion Agreement or this Agreement in any jurisdiction
except as provided in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 19</u></b>.
Any amendment, variation or modification to
this Agreement will be binding upon each Supplier Affiliate and each Kraft
Affiliate to the extent that the provisions of this Agreement apply (expressly
or by implication) to the business arrangements entered into by those parties</p>


 <p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-01.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:12 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">pursuant
to the Companion Agreement, whether such Companion Agreement was entered into
before or after the said amendment, variation or modification came into effect.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Associated
Contract Documents.</b><a name="a2_4AssociatedContractDocuments__132233"></a></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This Agreement includes each of the following
Schedules and Exhibits, all of which are attached to this Agreement and
incorporated into this Agreement by this reference. Unless otherwise expressly
stated, references to specific Schedules include all numbered subsidiary
Schedules (e.g<i>.</i>, references to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 1</u></b> mean, collectively, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 1</u></b> and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
1.1</u></b>, and references to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2</u></b>
mean, collectively, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedules 2.1</u>, <u>2.2</u>,
<u>2.3</u>, <u>2.4</u>, and <u>2.5</u></b>).</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Definitions</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>IT

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Subcontractors</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Acquired
Assets</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Transition
Plan</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21.1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Policies
and Procedures Manual Content</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Transformation
Plan</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Termination
Assistance Services</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24.1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Direct
Kraft Competitors</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24.2</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Direct
Supplier Competitors</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Approved
Benchmarkers</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Directed
Employees</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Global
Personal Data Protection Principles</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lifecycle
Projects</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exhibit 1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Form
of Companion Agreement</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exhibit 2</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>[Not
used]</p>

of Non-Disclosure Agreement</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 41.4pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exhibit 4</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Form
of Invoice</p>
