<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.2.10</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Kraft
Personnel Injury Claims</b>. Any claim by Kraft Personnel for death, personal
injury or bodily injury suffered on a Supplier Facility, except to the extent
caused by Supplier&#146;s gross negligence or willful misconduct.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Additional
Indemnities</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Supplier agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless
the Entities and individuals that are entitled to indemnification pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section&nbsp;17.1</u></b>, and Kraft agrees
to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the Entities and individuals that are
entitled to indemnification pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.2</u></b>,
from any and all Losses and threatened Losses to the extent they arise from or
in connection with any of the following:&#160;
(a) except as otherwise provided in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.1.10 </u></b>or
<b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.2.10</u></b>, third party claims
arising from the death, personal injury or bodily injury of any agent,
employee, customer, business invitee, business visitor or other person caused
by the negligence or other tortious conduct of the indemnitor or the failure of
the indemnitor to comply with its obligations under this Agreement; and (b) the
damage, loss or destruction of any third party&#146;s real or tangible personal
property caused by the negligence or other tortious conduct of the indemnitor
or the failure of the indemnitor to comply with its obligations under this
Agreement.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Infringement</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event that (i) any Software, Equipment,
Materials or Services for which Supplier has an indemnification obligation
pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.1.5</u></b> or for which
Kraft has an indemnification obligation pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
17.2.5</u></b>, or in the reasonable opinion of the Party with the
indemnification obligation, are likely to be found, to infringe upon the
patent, copyright, trademark, trade secrets, intellectual property or
proprietary rights of any third party in any country in which Services are to
be performed or received under this Agreement, or (ii) the continued use of
such item(s) is enjoined, the party with the indemnification obligation shall,
in addition to defending, indemnifying and holding harmless the other Party as
provided in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.1.5</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.2.5</u></b>, as applicable, and
to the other rights the non-indemnifying Party may have under this Agreement,
promptly and at its own cost and expense and in such a manner as to minimize
the disturbance to the non-indemnifying Party&#146;s business activities do one of
the following (subject to any applicable limitation of liability set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.3.2</u></b>):</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.4.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Obtain
Rights</b>. Obtain for the non-indemnifying Party the legal right to continue
using such Software, Equipment or Materials.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.4.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Modification</b>.
Modify the item(s) in question so that it is no longer infringing (provided
that such modification does not degrade the performance or quality of the
Services or adversely affect Kraft&#146;s and the Eligible Recipients&#146; intended use
as contemplated by this Agreement).</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.4.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Replacement</b>.
Replace such item(s) with a non-infringing functional equivalent acceptable to
Kraft.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.4.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Removal</b>.
If Kraft is the indemnifying Party, Kraft may at its option elect to require
Supplier to discontinue use of the infringing Material, in which case Supplier
shall be excused to the extent such removal prevents Supplier from meeting any
of its performance obligations under this Agreement.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.5</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Indemnification
Procedures</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With respect to non-Party claims which are subject to
indemnification under this Agreement (other than as provided in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.6</u></b> with respect to claims
covered by <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.1.6</u></b>), the following
procedures shall apply:</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">120</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='120',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-21.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:39 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.5.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Notice</b>.
Promptly after receipt by any entity entitled to indemnification under this
Agreement of notice of the commencement or threatened commencement of any
civil, criminal, administrative, or investigative action or proceeding
involving a claim in respect of which the indemnitee will seek indemnification
hereunder, the indemnitee shall notify the indemnitor of such claim. No delay
or failure to so notify an indemnitor shall relieve it of its obligations under
this Agreement except to the extent that such indemnitor has suffered actual
prejudice by such delay or failure. Within 15 days following receipt of notice
from the indemnitee relating to any claim, but no later than five days before
the date on which any response to a complaint or summons is due, the indemnitor
shall notify the indemnitee that the indemnitor elects to assume control of the
defense and settlement of that claim (a &#147;<b>Notice of Election</b>&#148;).</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.5.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Procedure
Following Notice of Election</b>. If the indemnitor delivers a Notice of
Election within the required notice period, the indemnitor shall assume sole
control over the defense and settlement of the claim; provided, however, that
(i) the indemnitor shall keep the indemnitee fully apprised at all times as to
the status of the defense, and (ii) the indemnitor shall obtain the prior
written approval of the indemnitee before entering into any settlement of such
claim asserting any liability against the indemnitee or imposing any
obligations or restrictions on the indemnitee or ceasing to defend against such
claim. The indemnitor shall not be liable for any legal fees or expenses
incurred by the indemnitee following the delivery of a Notice of Election;
provided, however, that (i) the indemnitee shall be entitled to employ counsel
at its own expense to participate in the handling of the claim, and (ii) the
indemnitor shall pay the fees and expenses associated with such counsel if
there is a conflict of interest with respect to such claim which is not
otherwise resolved or if the indemnitor has requested the assistance of the
indemnitee in the defense of the claim or the indemnitor has failed to defend
the claim diligently and the indemnitee is prejudiced or likely to be
prejudiced by such failure. The indemnitor shall not be obligated to indemnify
the indemnitee for any amount paid or payable by such indemnitee in the
settlement of any claim if (A) the indemnitor has delivered a timely Notice of
Election and such amount was agreed to without the written consent of the
indemnitor, (B) the indemnitee has not provided the indemnitor with notice of
such claim and a reasonable opportunity to respond thereto, or (C) the time
period within which to deliver a Notice of Election has not yet expired.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.5.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Procedure Where
No Notice of Election Is Delivered</b>. If the indemnitor does not deliver a
Notice of Election relating to any claim within the required notice period, the
indemnitee shall have the right to defend the claim in such manner as it may
deem appropriate. The indemnitor shall promptly reimburse the indemnitee for
all such reasonable costs and expenses incurred by the indemnitee, including
reasonable attorneys&#146; fees.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.6</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Indemnification
Procedures &#150; Governmental Claims</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With respect to claims covered by <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
17.1.6</u></b>, the following procedures shall apply:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.6.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Notice</b>.
Promptly after receipt by the indemnitee of notice of the commencement or
threatened commencement of any action or proceeding involving a claim in
respect of which the indemnitee will seek indemnification pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.1.6</u></b>, the indemnitee
shall notify the indemnitor of such claim. No delay or failure to so notify the
indemnitor shall relieve the indemnitor of its obligations under this Agreement
except to the extent that the indemnitor has suffered actual prejudice by such
delay or failure.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.6.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Procedure for
Defense</b>. The indemnitee shall be entitled, at its option, to have the claim
handled pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.5</u></b>
or to retain sole control over the defense and settlement of such claim;
provided that, in the latter case, the indemnitee shall (i) consult with the
indemnitor on a regular basis regarding claim processing (including actual and
anticipated costs and expenses) and</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">121</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='121',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-23.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:43 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">litigation
strategy, (ii) reasonably consider any the indemnitor settlement proposals or
suggestions, and (iii) use commercially reasonable efforts to minimize any
amounts payable or reimbursable by the indemnitor.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.7</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Subrogation</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Except as otherwise provided in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
16.1</u></b>, in the event that an indemnitor shall be obligated to
indemnify an indemnitee pursuant to any provision of this Agreement, the
indemnitor shall, upon payment of such indemnity in full, be subrogated to all
rights of the indemnitee with respect to the claims to which such
indemnification relates.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>LIABILITY</b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>General
Intent</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subject to the specific provisions and limitations of
this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 18</u></b>, it is the intent of the
Parties that each Party shall be liable to the other Party for any actual
damages incurred by the non-breaching Party as a result of the breaching Party&#146;s
failure to perform its obligations in the manner required by this Agreement.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Force
Majeure</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.2.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>General</b>.
Subject to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.2.4</u></b>, no Party shall
be liable for any default or delay in the performance of its obligations under
this Agreement if and to the extent such default or delay is caused, directly
or indirectly, by fire, flood, earthquake, elements of nature or acts of God,
wars, riots, civil disorders, rebellions or revolutions, acts of terrorism, or
any other similar cause beyond the reasonable control of such Party except to
the extent that the non-performing Party could not have prevented such default
or delay using reasonable precautions, and provided that such default or delay
cannot reasonably be circumvented by the non-performing Party through the use
of alternate sources, workaround plans or other means. A strike, lockout or
labor dispute involving Supplier Personnel shall not excuse Supplier from its
obligations hereunder. The failure of any Equipment, Software or System for
which Supplier is operationally responsible to be year 2000 compliant shall not
be considered a force majeure event and shall not relieve Supplier of any of
its obligations under this Agreement, including its obligations to perform the
Services in accordance with the Service Levels. In addition, the refusal of
Supplier Personnel to enter a facility that is the subject of a labor dispute
shall excuse Supplier from its obligations hereunder only if and to the extent
such refusal is based upon a reasonable fear of physical harm.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.2.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Duration and
Notification</b>. In the event of a force majeure event the non-performing
Party shall be excused from further performance or observance of the
obligation(s) so affected for as long as such circumstances prevail and such
Party continues to use commercially reasonable efforts to recommence
performance or observance whenever and to whatever extent possible without
delay. Any Party so prevented, hindered or delayed in its performance shall, as
quickly as practicable under the circumstances, notify the Party to whom
performance is due by telephone (to be confirmed in writing within one day of
the inception of such delay) and describe at a reasonable level of detail the
circumstances of the force majeure event, the steps being taken to address such
force majeure event, and the expected duration of such force majeure event.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.2.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Substitute
Services; Termination</b>. If any event described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
18.2.1</u></b> has substantially prevented, hindered or delayed or is
reasonably expected to substantially prevent, hinder or delay the performance
by Supplier or one of its Subcontractors of Services necessary for the
performance of critical Kraft or Eligible Recipient functions for longer than
the recovery period specified in the applicable disaster recovery plan or, if
there is no such recovery period,&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>, </p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">122</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='122',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-23.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:43 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft
may procure such Services from an alternate source, and Supplier shall be
solely liable for payment for such services from the alternate source for so
long as the delay in performance shall continue, provided that Kraft continues
to pay Supplier the Charges for such Services with respect to the period of
non-performance, and Kraft has not terminated the affected portion of the
Services. Kraft may at its option elect to pay the alternate source directly in
lieu of paying Supplier for the affected services. In addition, if any event
described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.2.1</u></b> substantially
prevents, hinders or delays the performance by Supplier or one of its
Subcontractors of Services necessary for the performance of critical Kraft
functions (i) for more than&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> days, and Supplier has not
obtained such Services from another source on a temporary basis, Kraft, at its
option, may terminate any portion of this Agreement so affected and the charges
payable hereunder shall be equitably adjusted to reflect those terminated
Services; or (ii) for more than&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> days, and Supplier has not
obtained the Services from another source on a temporary basis,&#160; Kraft, at its option, may terminate this
Agreement in its entirety. If the termination described in the preceding
sentence results from&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> that impacts a Supplier Facility
or that otherwise&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
from being able to&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
shall not be obligated to pay any&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> in connection with&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>.
<b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> shall be obligated to pay
the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
in the event the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
results from a&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
on a <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>. Except as described above,&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
shall not have the right to additional&#160;&#160;&#160;
<b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> or increased&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
as a result of any&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
affecting&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
ability to <b>&#160;*&#160; *&#160; *</b>.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.2.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Disaster
Recovery and Business Continuity Plans</b>. Within 90 days after the Effective
Date or by the Commencement Date, whichever occurs first, Supplier shall
document its disaster-recovery plan for the Services and ensure that it is
consistent with and will operate in conjunction with the standards and plans
referred to in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedules 15</u></b>
and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">16</u></b>. Supplier shall execute its
disaster-recovery plan upon the occurrence of a disaster and cooperate with
Kraft in the execution of Kraft&#146;s and/or the Eligible Recipients&#146;
business-continuity and disaster-recovery plans.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.2.5</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Payment
Obligation</b>. If Supplier fails to provide Services in accordance with this
Agreement due to the occurrence of a force majeure event, all amounts payable
to Supplier hereunder shall be equitably adjusted in a manner such that Kraft
is not required to pay any amounts for Services that it is not receiving from
Supplier, unless such Services are obtained from an alternate source at
Supplier&#146;s expense pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.2.3</u></b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.2.6</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Allocation of
Resources</b>. Without limiting Supplier&#146;s obligations under this Agreement,
whenever a force majeure event or disaster causes Supplier to allocate limited
resources between or among Supplier&#146;s customers and Affiliates, Kraft and the
Eligible Recipients shall receive at least the same treatment as comparable
Supplier customers. In no event will Supplier re-deploy or re-assign any Key
Supplier Personnel to another customer or account in the event of the
occurrence of a force majeure event.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Limitation
of Liability</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.3.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Exclusions from
Liability</b>. EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN THIS <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">SECTION 18.3</u></b>,
NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL,
INCIDENTAL, COLLATERAL, EXEMPLARY OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING LOST PROFITS,
REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF THE ACTION OR THE THEORY OF RECOVERY, EVEN IF SUCH
PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.3.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b>Liability
Caps.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">123</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='123',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-23.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:43 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.2.1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>*&#160; *&#160; * Liability Cap</b>. Additionally,
except as provided below in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.3.3</u></b>,
the total aggregate liability of either Party for claims (other than claims
that are referenced in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.3.2.2)</u></b>
asserted by the other Party under or in connection with this Agreement
(including claims arising from parties to a Companion Agreement), regardless of
the form of the action or the theory of recovery, shall be limited to (1)&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
for claims for which the last act or omission giving rise to such liability
occurs within the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
months after the Commencement Date, or (ii) the total Charges payable to
Supplier (including amounts payable to a Supplier Affiliate under a Companion
Agreement) during the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> period preceding the last act or
omission giving rise to such liability for claims for which the last act or
omission giving rise to such liability occurs more than&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
after the Commencement Date.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.2.2</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>*&#160; *&#160; * Liability Cap.</b>  <font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;">(a) Supplier&#146;s liability </b></font>under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.1.1</u></b> for third party
claims that arise from a breach of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 15.10.1</u></b>,
and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.1.4</u></b>,<font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;"> and Losses occasioned by any breach of its
obligations under </b><u>Article 13</u></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;"> and </b><u>Section 15.10.1</u></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;">, and (b) Kraft&#146;s liability under </b><u>Section
17.2.1</u></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;"> for third party
claims that arise from a breach of </b><u>Section 15.10.7</u>,</font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;"> </b><u>Section 17.2.4</u></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;">, and Losses occasioned by any breach of its
obligations under&#160; </b><u>Article
13</u></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;"> and </b><u>Section
15.10.7</u></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;">, in the
aggregate for each Party </b></font>(including claims arising from
parties to a Companion Agreement)<font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;">, </b></font>shall
be limited to (i)&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> for claims for which the last
act or omission giving rise to such liability occurs within the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160;
*&#160; </b>months after the
Commencement Date, or (ii) the total Charges payable to Supplier (including
amounts payable to a Supplier Affiliate under a Companion Agreement) during
the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
period preceding the last act or omission giving rise to such liability, for
claims for which the last act or omission giving rise to such liability occurs
more than&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
after the Commencement Date. <font style="font-weight:bold;"><b style="font-weight:normal;">For the
avoidance of doubt, </b></font>the&#160;
<b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> cap referred to above in this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.3.2.2</u></b> is separate and
apart from the cap referred to in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.3.2.1. </u></b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.3.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b>Exceptions
to Limitations of Liability.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.3.1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>18.3.3.1</b> The exclusions set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
18.3.1</u>  </b>and the liability caps set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
18.3.2</u></b> shall not apply with respect to Losses occasioned by the <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>,&#160;
<b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> of a Party.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.3.2</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
exclusions set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.3.1</u></b>
shall not apply to amounts paid with respect to&#160;

indemnification pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Sections</u>&#160; *&#160;
*&#160; *</b>. Losses occasioned by any
breach of a Party&#146;s obligations under&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">18.3.3.3</font></b></font><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:normal;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b></font>The liability cap set

may</p>

For purposes of this provision, &#147;<b>refusal</b>&#148; shall
mean the intentional cessation by&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>, in a manner impermissible under
this Agreement, of the performance of all or a material portion of the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
then required to be provided by&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> under this Agreement.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.3.7</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The

*&#160; * </b>with respect to&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
of an&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
or&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.3.8</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.3.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Items Not

to, and shall not be counted toward the liability exclusions or caps specified
in, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.3.1</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">18.3.2</u></b>:</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.4.1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>*&#160; *&#160; * </b>assessed against&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
pursuant to&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>,
recognizing that the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> will reduce the amount paid
by&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
and thereby have the effect of reducing&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> limitation of liability where
such liability is calculated based on the fees paid by&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
during the applicable period.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.4.2</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.4.5</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> reimbursement obligations under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section</u>&#160;

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.3.5</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Waiver of
Liability Cap</b>. If, at any time, the total aggregate liability of one Party
for adjudicated claims by the other Party that arise under or in connection
with this Agreement during the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> after the Commencement Date
exceeds&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>%
of either of the liability caps specified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
18.3.2</u></b> and, within&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> from receipt of the request of
the other Party, the Party incurring such liability refuses to waive such cap
and/or increase the available cap to an amount at least equal to the original
liability cap, then the other Party may&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> this Agreement without payment
of&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.3.6</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Acknowledged

consequential or special damages or</p>

under this Agreement.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.6.5</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> incurred by either Party,
including <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> of additional <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>, <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
charges.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.6.6</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Costs
and expenses incurred to bring&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> or to contract to obtain <b>*&#160; *&#160; * </b>including the costs and expenses
associated with the retention of <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
and&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
to assist with any <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
resulting from a&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section</u>&#160;
*&#160; *&#160; *</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.6.7</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Damages
of a&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
which are direct damages of such&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> and which would be direct
damages of&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
if they had instead been suffered by <b>&#160;*&#160;
*&#160; *</b> (including being
so considered under this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 18.37</u></b>).</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.6.8</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> remedies imposed by a <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> or&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
or&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
for failure to comply with requirements or deadlines in violation of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section</u>&#160;
*&#160; *&#160; *</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18.3.6.9</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lost&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
incurred by&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
and the&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
to the extent arising as the result of&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> failure to properly review and <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> to <b>&#160;*&#160;
*&#160; *</b> as required by this
Agreement.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>DISPUTE
RESOLUTION</b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Informal
Dispute Resolution</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to the initiation of formal dispute resolution
procedures with respect to any dispute, other than as provided in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.4</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 20.8</u></b>, the Parties shall
first attempt to resolve such dispute informally, as follows:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.1.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Initial Effort</b>.
The Parties agree that the Kraft Contract Manager and the Supplier Account
Executive shall attempt in good faith to resolve the dispute. In the event the
Kraft Contract Manager and the Supplier Account Executive are unable to resolve
a dispute in an amount of time that either Party deems reasonable under the
circumstances, such Party may refer the dispute for resolution to the senior
corporate executives specified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.1.2</u></b>
below upon written notice to the other Party.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.1.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Escalation</b>.
Within five business days of a notice under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
19.1.1</u></b> above referring a dispute for resolution by senior
corporate executives, the Kraft Contract Manager and the Supplier Account
Executive will each prepare and provide to a Supplier Vice President and
General Manager, United States and the Kraft Chief Financial Officer,
respectively, summaries of the non-privileged relevant information and
background of the dispute, along with any appropriate non-privileged supporting
documentation, for their review. The designated senior corporate executives
will confer as often as they deem reasonably necessary in order to gather and
furnish to the other all non-privileged information with respect to the matter
in issue which the Parties</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">126</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='126',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-23.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:43 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">believe
to be appropriate and germane in connection with its resolution. The designated
senior corporate executives shall discuss the problem and negotiate in good
faith in an effort to resolve the dispute without the necessity of any formal
proceeding. The specific format for the discussions will be left to the
discretion of the designated senior corporate executives, but may include the
preparation of agreed-upon statements of fact or written statements of
position.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.1.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Provision of
Information</b>. During the course of negotiations under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
19.1.1</u></b> or&#160; <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.1.2</u></b> above, all
reasonable requests made by one Party to another for non-privileged
information, reasonably related to the dispute, will be honored in order that
each of the parties may be fully advised of the other&#146;s position. All
negotiation shall be strictly confidential and used solely for the purposes of
settlement. Any materials prepared by one Party for these proceedings shall not
be used as evidence by the other Party in any subsequent arbitration or
litigation; provided, however, the underlying facts supporting such materials
may be subject to discovery.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.1.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Prerequisite to
Arbitration</b>. Arbitration of a dispute may not be commenced until the
earlier of:</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.1.4.1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
designated senior corporate executives under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
19.1.2</u></b> above concluding in good faith that amicable resolution
through continued negotiation of the matter does not appear likely; or</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.1.4.2</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>30
days after the notice under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.1.1</u></b>
above referring the dispute to senior corporate executives.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Non-Binding
Mediation.</b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.2.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Requirement to
Attempt Non-Binding Mediation. </b>Except for disputes described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.4</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 20.8</u></b> or termination of this
Agreement pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 20</u></b>,
any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or any breach
thereof, which cannot be resolved using the procedures set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.1</u></b> shall be first
attempted to be resolved through non-binding mediation under the mediation
rules of the Center for Public Resources.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.2.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Location and
Decision</b>. The mediation shall take place in Chicago, Illinois, and shall
apply the governing law of this Agreement. The recommendations of the mediators
shall be non-binding. The mediators shall be instructed to state the reasons
for their recommendations. The mediators shall be bound by the warranties,
limitations of liability and other provisions of this Agreement.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.2.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Selection and
Qualification of Mediators</b>. Within 10 days after delivery of written notice
(&#147;<b>Notice of Mediation</b>&#148;) by one Party to
the other in accordance with this Section, the Parties each shall use good
faith efforts to mutually agree upon one mediator. If the Parties are not able
to agree upon one mediator within such period of time, the Parties each shall
within 10 days: (i) appoint one mediator who has at no time ever represented or
acted on behalf of either of the Parties, and is not otherwise affiliated with
or interested in either of the Parties and (ii) deliver written notice of the
identity of such mediator and a copy of his or her written acceptance of such
appointment to the other Party. If either Party fails or refuses to appoint a
mediator within such 10-day period, the single mediator appointed by the other
Party shall decide alone the issues set out in the Notice of Mediation. Within
10 days after such appointment and notice, such mediators shall appoint a third
neutral and independent arbitrator who at no time ever represented or acted on
behalf of either of the Parties, and is not otherwise affiliated with or
interested in either of the Parties. In the event that the two mediators fail
to appoint a third mediator within 10 days of the appointment of the second
mediator, either mediator or either Party may apply for the appointment of a
third mediator to the Center for Public Resources.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">127</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='127',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-23.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:43 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.2.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>General</b>.
All mediators shall be practicing attorneys with at least five years&#146;
experience with the business processes, technology and law applicable to the
Services or similar services or transactions. The Parties shall use
commercially reasonable efforts to conclude the mediation within 60 days after
selection of the mediator or mediators. The recommendations of the mediator or
the majority of the three mediators, as applicable, shall be rendered within 15
days after the conclusion of the hearing, shall be in writing, shall set forth
the basis therefore. Each Party shall bear its own mediation costs and expenses
and all other costs and expenses of the mediation shall be divided equally between
the Parties.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Arbitration.</b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.3.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Arbitration</b>.
Except for disputes described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.4</u></b>,
any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or any
breach thereof, which cannot be resolved using the procedures set forth above
in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.1</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">19.2</u></b> shall be finally resolved
under the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association
then in effect; provided, however, that without limiting any rights at law or
in equity a Party may have because of an improper termination of this Agreement
by the other Party, nothing contained in this Agreement shall limit either
Party&#146;s right to terminate this Agreement pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article
20</u></b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.3.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Location and
Decision. </b>Any arbitration under this Agreement shall take place in Chicago,
Illinois, and shall apply the governing law of this Agreement. The decision of
the arbitrators shall be final and binding and judgment on the award may be
entered in any court of competent jurisdiction. The arbitrators shall be
instructed to state the reasons for their decisions, including findings of fact
and law. The arbitrators shall be bound by the warranties, limitations of
liability and other provisions of this Agreement. Except with respect to the
provisions of this Agreement which provide for injunctive relief rights, such
arbitration shall be a precondition to any application by either Party to any
court of competent jurisdiction.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.3.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Selection and
Qualification of Arbitrators. </b>Within 30 days, or such reasonable period
mutually agreed upon by the Parties, after delivery of written notice (&#147;<b>Notice of Arbitration</b>&#148;) by one Party to the other in
accordance with this Section, the Parties each shall use good faith efforts to
mutually agree upon one arbitrator. If the Parties are not able to agree upon
one arbitrator within such period of time, the Parties each shall within 30
days: (i) appoint one arbitrator who has at no time ever represented or acted
on behalf of either of the Parties, and is not otherwise affiliated with or
interested in either of the Parties and (ii) deliver written notice of the
identity of such arbitrator and a copy of his or her written acceptance of such
appointment to the other Party. If either Party fails or refuses to appoint an
arbitrator within such 30-day period, the single arbitrator appointed by the
other Party shall decide alone the issues set out in the Notice of Arbitration.
Within 30 days after such appointment and notice, such arbitrators shall
appoint a third neutral and independent arbitrator who at no time ever
represented or acted on behalf of either of the Parties, and is not otherwise
affiliated with or interested in either of the Parties. In the event that the
two arbitrators fail to appoint a third arbitrator within 30 days of the
appointment of the second arbitrator, either arbitrator or either Party may
apply for the appointment of a third arbitrator to the American Arbitration
Association.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.3.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Scope of
Discovery</b>. Subject to the last two sentences of this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
19.3.4</u></b>, discovery will be limited to the request for and
production of documents, depositions and interrogatories. Interrogatories will
be allowed only as follows:&nbsp; a Party may request the other Party to
identify by name, last known address and telephone number (i) all persons having
knowledge of facts relevant to the dispute and a brief description of that
person&#146;s knowledge, (ii) any experts who may be called as an expert witness,
the subject matter about which the expert is expected to testify, the mental
impressions and opinions held by the expert and the facts known by the expert</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">128</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='128',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-23.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:43 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(regardless
of when the factual information was acquired) that relate to or form the basis
for the mental impressions and opinions held by the expert, and (iii)&nbsp;any
experts who have been used for consultation, but who are not expected to be
called as an expert witness, if such consulting expert&#146;s opinions or
impressions have been reviewed by an expert witness.&nbsp; All discovery will
be governed by the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.&nbsp; All issues
concerning discovery upon which the Parties cannot agree will be submitted to
the arbitrator for determination. Nothing in this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
19.3.4</u></b> shall preclude either party from seeking limited third
party discovery under applicable AAA<b> </b>Rules or the
laws of the State of Illinois in the discretion of the arbitrator. In addition,
should a Party be able to prove that it will be unfairly prejudiced without
additional discovery on a certain issue, the arbitrator in its discretion can
permit additional limited discovery for the purpose of improving the efficiency
of the arbitration proceeding.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.3.5</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>General</b>.
All arbitrators shall be attorneys with experience with the technology and/or
law applicable to the Services or similar services or transactions. Any such
appointment shall be binding upon the Parties. The arbitrator will not have
authority to award damages in excess of the amount or other than the types
allowed by<b> <u>Section 18.3</u></b> and may not, in
any event, make any ruling, finding or award that does not conform to the terms
and conditions of this Agreement. The decision or award of the arbitrator or
arbitrators shall be final, binding and nonappealable, and may be enforced and
executed upon in any court having jurisdiction over the Party against whom the
enforcement of such decision or award is sought. Upon the request of a Party,
the arbitrator&#146;s award will include written findings of fact and conclusions of
law.&nbsp;&#160; Each Party shall bear its own
arbitration costs, attorneys&#146; fees and expenses.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.4</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Equitable
Remedies.</b></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.4.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Eligible
Disputes</b>. Notwithstanding the provisions of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
19.1</u></b>, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.2</u></b>,
and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.3</u></b>, either Party may
institute formal proceedings to obtain injunctive relief in order to:</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.4.1.1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>avoid
the expiration of any applicable limitations period,</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.4.1.2</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>preserve
a superior position with respect to other creditors,</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.4.1.3</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>address
a claim arising out of the breach of a Party&#146;s obligations under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 13</u></b>,</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.4.1.4</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>address
a claim arising out of the breach or attempted or threatened breach of the obligations
described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.4.2</u></b>, or</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19.4.1.5</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>prevent
other damages that are so immediate, so large or severe, and so incapable of
adequate redress after the fact that a temporary restraining order or other
immediate injunctive relief is the only adequate remedy.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.4.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Irreparable
Harm</b>. <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> acknowledges that, in the event
it breaches (or attempts or threatens to breach) its obligation to&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
in accordance with this Agreement, its obligation respecting&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
in accordance with<b><u style="font-weight:bold;"> Section</u>&#160; *&#160; *&#160; *</b>, or its obligation to provide&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
in accordance with<b><u style="font-weight:bold;"> Section </u>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>,
<b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> and/or&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
will be irreparably harmed.&nbsp;&nbsp; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
acknowledgement is based on its reliance on&#160;
<b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> representation that it would
only utilize the provisions of this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.4.2</u></b>
when it has a good faith belief that it needs to obtain injunctive relief as
quickly as possible to avoid an adverse impact on the ability of&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
to conduct any segment of its business which
would be prevented or unreasonably disrupted in the event&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
denies, withdraws or restricts its&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> to&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
or withholds&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
access to&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>.&nbsp;
In such a circumstance,&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> may proceed directly to court.
If a court of competent jurisdiction should find that&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
has breached (or attempted or threatened to breach) any such obligations,&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">129</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='129',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-23.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:43 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">agrees
that without any additional findings of irreparable injury or other conditions
to injunctive relief,&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> shall be entitled to seek and
obtain injunctive relief, including&nbsp;entry of an appropriate order
compelling performance by&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> and restraining it from any
further breaches (or attempted or threatened breaches).</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.4.3</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Attorney&#146;s Fees</b>.
A Party filing a pleading seeking immediate injunctive relief, which is not
awarded in substantial part, shall pay all reasonable costs and attorneys&#146; fees
of the other Party.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.5</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Jurisdiction.</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each Party irrevocably agrees that any legal action,
suit or proceeding brought by it in any way arising out of this Agreement must
be brought solely and exclusively in Illinois, and each Party irrevocably
submits to the sole and exclusive jurisdiction of the federal and state courts
in Cook County, Illinois, <i>in personam</i>,
generally and unconditionally with respect to any action, suit or proceeding
brought by it or against it by the other Party.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.6</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Continued
Performance</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.6.1</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>General</b>.
Subject to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.6.2</u></b>, each Party
agrees that it shall, unless otherwise directed by the other Party, continue
performing its obligations under this Agreement while any dispute is being
resolved; provided, that this provision shall not operate or be construed as
extending the Term of this Agreement or prohibiting or delaying a Party&#146;s
exercise of any right it may have to terminate the Term as to all or any part
of the Services. For purposes of clarification, Kraft Data may not be withheld
by Supplier pending the resolution of any dispute.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.6.2</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Non-Interruption
of Service</b>. Supplier acknowledges and agrees that any interruption to the
Service may cause irreparable harm to Kraft and/or the Eligible Recipients, in
which case an adequate remedy at law would not be available. Subject to
Supplier&#146;s right to terminate the Term pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
20.1.2</u></b>, Supplier expressly acknowledges and agrees that, pending
resolution of any dispute or controversy, it shall not deny, withdraw or
restrict Supplier&#146;s provision of the Services to Kraft and/or the Eligible
Recipients under this Agreement, except as specifically and expressly agreed in
writing by Kraft and Supplier.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.7</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Governing
Law</b>.</p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This Agreement and performance under it shall be
governed by and construed in accordance with the applicable laws of the State
of Illinois, without giving effect to the principles thereof relating to
conflicts of laws. The application of the United Nations Convention on
Contracts for the International Sale of Goods is expressly excluded.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">19.8</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Expiration
of Claims.</b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Without altering either Party&#146;s rights or obligations
under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 12.1.4</u></b>, no claims to be
resolved under this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 19</u></b> may
be asserted by either Party more than four (4) years after the later of (i) the
last date on which the act or omission giving rise to the claim occurred, or
(ii) with respect to invoices issued under this Agreement, the date on which
such act or omission was discovered or should reasonably have been discovered
(the election to conduct or not to conduct an audit with respect to an invoice
shall not, in and of itself, be evidence of reasonableness for this purpose);
provided, however, that the foregoing shall not apply to claims based upon a
Party&#146;s fraud or willful misconduct, or a claim for which a Party has an
indemnity obligation under this Agreement in which event the applicable statute
of limitations shall apply. Failure to make such a claim (but not including
claims referred to in the <i>proviso </i>of the
preceding sentence) within such four-year period shall forever bar the claim.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">130</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">
