<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">S-</font><font face="Times New Roman">1</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='S-1',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-26.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:47 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SCHEDULE 1</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DEFINITIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">References to the
preamble, articles, sections, schedules and exhibits in this <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 1</u></b> are to the preamble,
Articles and Sections of, and Schedules and Exhibits to, the Agreement unless
otherwise specified. As used in this Agreement:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Acceptance</b>&#148; shall mean the determination, in Kraft&#146;s sole
reasonable discretion, following implementation, installation, testing&#160; and execution in the production environment
for an agreed upon number of business cycles that Software, Equipment, Systems
and/or other contract deliverables are in Compliance in all material respects
with the Specifications.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Acquired Assets Credit</b>&#148; shall mean the amount (if any) set
forth on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4</u></b> that Supplier will
pay to Kraft as consideration for the Acquired Assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Acquired Assets</b>&#148; shall mean the Equipment, Software and
other assets (if any) owned or controlled by Kraft or the Eligible Recipients
and listed on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 20</u></b> that Supplier will
acquire pursuant to the terms of this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Actual Uptime</b>&#148; shall mean shall mean the measurement of time
that a particular System, Application, Software, Equipment, Network or any
other part of the Services is actually available during the Measurement Window,
and such measurement will be calculated by subtracting Downtime from the
Scheduled Uptime.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Actual Volumes</b>&#148; means, for each Resource Unit during each
applicable measurement period, the actual volume of that Resource Unit measured
for that period in accordance with <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.5</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Additional Resource Charge(s)</b>&#148; or &#147;<b>ARC(s)</b>&#148;
means, for any Billable Resource Unit, the incremental charge payable by Kraft
to Supplier based on the amount by which the Actual Volume of such Billable
Resource Unit exceeds the Resource Baseline for such Billable Resource Unit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Affected Contractors</b>&#148; means the Affected Personnel who are
contractors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Affected Kraft Foods Global Personnel</b>&#148; means the Kraft
Personnel, other than employees and contractors of Altria and its Affiliates,
who are identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 5.1</u></b>,
including all of the individuals listed in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 5.1.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Affected Personnel</b>&#148; means the Affected Kraft Foods Global
Personnel and the Affected Tech Center Personnel who are identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 5.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#147;<b>Affected Tech Center
Personnel</b>&#148; means the employees and&#160;
contractors of Altria and its Affiliates who are identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 5.1</u></b>, including all of the
individuals listed in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 5.1.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Affiliate</b>&#148; shall mean with respect to any Entity, any other
Entity that directly or indirectly Controls, is Controlled by or under common
Control with such Entity at the time in question.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Agreement</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the preamble to
this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>AICPA Auditors</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.10.9.1</u></b>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">1</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Allocation of Pool Percentage</b>&#148; shall mean the portion of the
Pool Percentage Available for Allocation that is specified for a Performance
Category. The total of all Allocation of Pool Percentages shall not exceed the
Pool Percentage Available for Allocation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Altria</b>&#148; shall mean Altria Group, Inc., a Virginia
corporation with its principal place of business at 120 Park Avenue, New York,
New York 10017.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Applicable Regulatory Authority</b>&#148; shall mean, in the United
States, the Federal Communications Commission (the &#147;<b>FCC</b>&#148;)
or comparable national, territorial, regional, state, provincial or local
regulatory bodies of competent jurisdictions and in geographic regions other
than the United States from, to or in which the Services are provided,
comparable national, territorial, regional, state, provincial or local
regulatory authorities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Application Server(s)</b>&#148; shall mean Wintel Servers, AIX
Servers, LINUX Servers, UNIX Servers, and AS/400 Servers..</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Applications Software</b>&#148; or &#147;<b>Applications</b>&#148;
shall mean Software that is used to support day-to-day business operations and
accomplish specific business objectives.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>ARC Rate</b>&#148; means, in relation to each Billable Resource Unit,
the amount specified as the &#147;ARC Rate&#148; for that Billable Resource Unit on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.1</u></b>, as adjusted pursuant
to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 12</u></b>of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
4</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Asset Inventory and Management System</b>&#148;
shall m</font>ean an electronic, database-driven application used to store,
query, and frequently update asset inventory information for all assets used in
association with the Services, whether the assets are located at Kraft Sites or
Supplier Facilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>At Risk Amount</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3</u></b>..</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Audit Period</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.10.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Authorized Users</b>&#148; shall mean users of Services within and
outside of Kraft including, but not limited to, Kraft employees, vendors,
customers and contractors.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Availability</b>&#148; shall mean the Actual Uptime expressed as a
percentage of the Scheduled Uptime for a particular System, Application,
Software, Equipment, Network, or any other part of the Services (i.e.
Availability % = ((Actual Uptime)/(Scheduled Uptime)) x 100%). </font>Where Systems are redundant, the outage of
one System will not be counted against Availability provided service is not
disrupted..</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Bankruptcy Code</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 20.6.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Bankruptcy Rejection</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 20.6.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Baseline FTEs</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.6.1.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Benchmarking Standard&#148;</b> shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 11.10.3</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Benchmarker</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b>&#160;<u>Section 11.10.1</u>.</b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Benchmarking</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 11.10.1</u></b>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Billable Resource Unit</b>&#148; means, in relation to each Resource
Unit that is requested or approved by Kraft or is generated by Kraft&#146;s business
activity and identified as a &#147;Billable Resource Unit&#148; on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
4.5</u></b>, for which distinct charging rates or other charging
mechanisms apply.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Brazilian Affected Personnel</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given
in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 8.1.1.6.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Business
Continuity (Services)</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the overall, company-wide plans and activities
that are intended to enable continued business operation in the event of any
unforeseen interruption.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Cable Plant</b>&#148; in all forms whether
capitalized or not shall mean the physical Cables and Wires that make up the
Network infrastructure.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Cabling</b>&#148;
or &#147;<b>Cable</b>&#148; shall mean</font> cables that come with ends that permit the
physical connection between Equipment and a wall jack or patch panel, including
physical cabling media, peripheral cabling used to interconnect electronic
equipment and all terminating hardware and cross connect fields, but not
including conduits and pathways.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Calls</b>&#148; shall mean the problems, questions, or requests
submitted to the Supplier by telephone, electronically, or other means approved
by Kraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Cause</b>&#148; shall mean (i) material breach of any agreement
entered into between the employee and Supplier; (ii) material misconduct; (iii)
material or repeated failure to follow Supplier&#146;s policies, directives or
orders applicable to Supplier employees holding comparable positions; (iv)
intentional destruction or theft of Supplier property or falsification of
Supplier documents; (v) material or repeated failure or refusal to faithfully,
diligently, and competently perform the usual and customary duties associated
with your position; (vi) conviction of a felony or any crime involving moral
turpitude; or (vii) material or repeated violation of the Supplier Code of
Business Conduct.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Change Control Procedures</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.6.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Charges</b>&#148; shall mean the amounts set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 11</u></b> and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
4</u></b> (or otherwise set forth in the Agreement) as charges due to
the Supplier in return for providing the Services, including the applicable
taxes payable under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 11.4</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Collaborative
Applications</b>&#148; </font>shall
mean Applications containing functionality to enable electronic communication
and messaging, work group collaboration, information transfers, frequently
asked questions, and similar Applications that allow collaborative interaction
and receipt/transfer of data and information both within and outside of Kraft.
Examples of current and/or future Collaborative Applications include electronic
mail, calendaring, and instant messaging.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Commencement Date</b>&#148; shall mean June 1, 2006, or such other
date as the Parties may agree upon in writing as the date on which Supplier
will assume full responsibility for such Services (except for the Services in
the Deferred Countries). Supplier&#146;s assumption of Services originating from
Deferred Countries shall occur in accordance with the Transition Plan, except
in the case of Slovakia, Ukraine, Bulgaria, Romania, Morocco, and Jamaica, for
which Supplier shall assume responsibility for the Services as soon as
practicable but in any event not later than (i) twelve (12) months after the
Commencement Date, in each case unless a later date has been approved or
specified by Kraft in writing. This Agreement shall be binding as of the
Effective Date, though certain obligations are contingent upon the Commencement
Date, as set forth in this Agreement.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Commercial
Off The Shelf</b>&#148; or &#147;</font><b>COTS</b>&#148; shall mean Equipment or
Software, as applicable, that is generally available to the public.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Companion Agreement</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b>Section 2.3.1</b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Compliance</b>&#148; and &#147;<b>Comply</b>&#148; shall
mean, with respect to outsourced business process(es), Software, Equipment,
Systems or other contract deliverables to be implemented, designed, developed,
delivered, integrated, installed and/or tested by Supplier, in compliance in
all material respects with the Specifications.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Conferencing (Services)</b>&#148; shall mean the
provision of audio, web and video conferencing services for Authorized Users as
described in the Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Conferencing
Premise Equipment</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the Equipment, features, accessories, and peripherals supported or
used by Supplier in connection with its provision of Conferencing Services to
the Authorized Users, including control computers, audio, web and video
conferencing bridges, muxes, multi-point bridging equipment, and associated
diagnostic equipment, and all additions, modifications, substitutions, Upgrades
or enhancements to such Equipment.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Conferencing Premise System</b>&#148; shall mean
the Conferencing Premise Equipment and associated Software supported or used by
Supplier in connection with its provision of Conferencing Services.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Connectivity</b>&#148;
shall mean</font> the ability to
electronically access and exchange data, voice, and/or video electronic
impulses between various infrastructure components and with external sources as
approved by Kraft and provided to Authorized Users.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Consumption-Based Resource Unit</b>&#148; means the Billable Resource
Units for which Kraft&#146;s charge is calculated on a specific unit of consumption,
and not on a monthly basis, such as FTE hours or telecom minutes usage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Contract Changes</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 11.1.5</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Contract Records</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.10.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#160;</font></i></b>&#147;<b>Contract
Year</b>&#148; shall mean the period ending 12 months after the Commencement
Date and on each anniversary of such ending date thereafter during the Term. If
any Contract Year is less than 12 months, the rights and obligations under this
Agreement that are calculated on a Contract Year basis will be proportionately
adjusted for such shorter period. .</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Control</b>&#148; and its derivatives shall mean:&#160; (a) the legal, beneficial, or equitable
ownership, directly or indirectly, of (i) more than 50% of the aggregate of all
voting equity interests in an Entity, or (ii) equity interests having the
right, in the event of dissolution, to more than 50% of the assets of an
Entity; (b) the right to appoint, directly or indirectly, a majority of the
board of directors; (c) the right to control, directly or indirectly, the
management or direction of the Entity by contract or corporate governance
document; or (d) in the case of a partnership, the holding by an Entity (or one
of its Affiliates) of the position of sole general partner.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Course</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
8.2.7</u></b>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Critical Affected Personnel</b>&#148; shall mean those individuals
identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 5.3</u></b> as critical to
the ongoing success of Supplier&#146;s delivery of information technology services
to Kraft and the Eligible Recipients. For those countries where the Critical
Affected Personnel are not designated as of the Effective Date, Kraft shall
designate by the Commencement Date&#160; (or
in the case of such individuals in Deferred Countries, at least by the date
that Supplier is required to make offers to those individuals pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 8.1.1.1)</u></b>&#160; no more than fifteen percent (15%) of the
Affected Personnel as Critical Affected Personnel, provided that the total
number of Critical Affected Personnel who are contractors cannot exceed five
percent (5%) of the number of Affected Personnel who are contractors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Critical Deliverables</b>&#148; shall mean those milestone activities
and deliverables identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.3</u></b>
that have associated Deliverable Credits payable to Kraft in the event Supplier
fails to deliver such deliverables in accordance with <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
3.3</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Critical Service Level</b>&#148; shall mean those Service Levels
established under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3</u></b>
for which a Service Level Credit may be payable. Critical Service Levels are
identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.1</u></b> and are described
in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.2</u></b>. Each Critical Service
Level has an Expected Service Level and a Minimum Service Level associated with
it unless otherwise specified. It is the intent of the Parties that all
Critical Service Levels shall be quantifiable, measurable, and objective.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Cross
Functional Services&#148;</b> shall mean</font> those Services described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2.1</u></b><u>
(Cross Functional &#150; General Services)</u> and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
2.2</u></b>  <u>(Cross Functional &#150; Equipment and Software Services)</u>.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Deferred Countries</b>&#148; shall mean all countries other than the
United States and Canada.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Deliverable Credits</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 7.2.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Derivative Work</b>&#148; shall mean a work based on one or more
preexisting works, including a condensation, transformation, translation,
modification, expansion, or adaptation, that, if prepared without authorization
of the owner of the copyright of such preexisting work, would constitute a
copyright infringement under applicable Law, but excluding the preexisting
work.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Developed Materials</b>&#148; shall mean any Materials, or any
modifications, enhancements or Derivative Works thereof, developed by or on
behalf of Supplier for Kraft or the Eligible Recipients as a result of or as
part of the Services excluding Materials developed at Supplier&#146;s leveraged
facilities for Supplier&#146;s customers generally and not specifically for Kraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Development Tool</b>&#148; shall mean all Software that is used in
the development, testing, deployment and maintenance of Applications.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">*&#160; *&#160; * </font></b>&#160;shall mean the Entities identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 24.1</u></b>, as well as
their&#160; successors and assigns, as such
list of Entities may be modified by Kraft from time to time, including any divested
portions of companies identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 24.1</u><i>. </i></b>Kraft may add to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 24.1</u></b>
other similar companies that may be created in the future, subject to Supplier&#146;s
approval.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Direct Supplier Competitor</b>&#148; shall mean the Entities
identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 24.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Directed Employee Period</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 8.14</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Directed Employee</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 8.14</u></b>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">5</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Disaster
Recovery (Services)</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the specific activities related to continued provisioning of the Services
in the event of an unforeseen interruption. Disaster Recovery activities
include support and coordination with the Business Continuity Services as
described in the Disaster Recovery Plan.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Disaster Recovery Plan</b>&#148; shall mean the
plan for recovering data, systems and services in the event of a disaster and
for continuing the performance of the Services.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Downtime</b>&#148; shall mean the period of time that a particular
System, Application, Software, Equipment, Network, or any other part of the
Services is not available during the Measurement Window. </font>During a switchover, the architected
switchover time will not be counted towards Downtime; however, the Downtime
encountered prior to making the decision to cut over will be counted against
Availability. Maintenance Downtime shall not be counted towards Downtime.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#147;DSD Device&#148; </font></b>shall
have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.5</u></b>.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Earnback</b>&#148; shall mean the methodology used to determine the
potential elimination of a Service Level Credit as described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.</u></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>EDS</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the preamble to this
Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Effective Date</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the preamble
to this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>EIS</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the preamble to this
Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Eligible Recipients</b>&#148; shall mean, collectively, and to the
extent such Entity is receiving Services under this Agreement, the following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Kraft;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
Entity that is an Affiliate of Kraft on the Effective Date, or thereafter
becomes an Affiliate of Kraft;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
Entity that purchases after the Effective Date from Kraft or any Affiliate of
Kraft, all or substantially all of the assets of Kraft or such Affiliate, or of
any division, marketing unit, business unit, administrative unit, or
manufacturing, research or development facility thereof, provided that such
Entity agrees in writing to be bound by the terms and conditions of this
Agreement;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
Entity that after the Effective Date is created using assets of Kraft or any
Affiliate of Kraft, provided that such Entity agrees in writing to be bound by
the terms and conditions of this Agreement;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
Entity into which Kraft or any Affiliate of Kraft merges or consolidates,
provided that such Entity has assumed Kraft&#146;s obligations under this Agreement,
and provided further that such Entity agrees in writing to be bound by the
terms and conditions of this Agreement;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(f)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
Entity which merges into or consolidates with Kraft or any Affiliate of Kraft;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(g)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
Entity, including any corporation, joint venture, or partnership, in which on
or after the Effective Date, Kraft or any Affiliate of Kraft has an ownership
interest and/or as to</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">6</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">which Kraft or such Affiliate has management or
operational responsibility by&#160; law or
contract;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(h)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
customer of an Eligible Recipient identified in clauses (a) through (h) above,
or an Entity to which such an Eligible Recipient is a contractor, but only in
connection with the provision of products or services by such Eligible
Recipient to such customer;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>any
person or Entity providing outsourcing services to Kraft or any Eligible
Recipient, but only in connection with the provision of such outsourcing
services to Kraft or such Eligible Recipient; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(j)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>other
entities to which the Parties agree.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Except as used in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Sections 17.1</u>, <u>17.3</u>, <u>17.4</u>,
<u>17.5</u></b>, and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">17.6</u></b>,
Eligible Recipients shall include the employees, contractors, subcontractors,
agents and representatives, but only in their capacities as such, of the
Entities identified as Eligible Recipients in clauses (a) through (j) above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Employment Effective Date</b>&#148; shall mean, with respect to each
Transitioned Employee, the date that such Transitioned Employee begins
employment with Supplier, in accordance with applicable Laws.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>End User
Computing (Services)</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the Services described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2.5</u></b><u> (End User Computing
Services)</u>.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Entity</b>&#148; shall mean a corporation, partnership, joint
venture, trust, limited liability company, limited liability partnership,
association or other organization or entity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Equipment</b>&#148; shall mean all computing, networking,
communications and related computing equipment (hardware and firmware)
procured, provided, operated, supported, or used by Kraft, Supplier or
Authorized Users in connection with the Services, including (i) mainframe,
midrange, server and distributed computing equipment and associated
attachments, features, accessories, peripheral devices, and cabling, (ii)
personal computers, laptop computers, terminals, workstations and associated
attachments, features, accessories, printers, multi-functional printers,
peripheral devices, and cabling, and (iii) voice, data, video and wireless
telecommunications and network and monitoring equipment and associated
attachments, features, accessories, cell phones, peripheral devices, and
cabling.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Equipment Leases</b>&#148; shall mean all leasing arrangements
whereby Kraft, the Eligible Recipients or a Kraft Third Party Contractor leases
Equipment as of the Commencement Date which will be used by Supplier to perform
the Services after the Commencement Date. Equipment Leases shall include those
leases identified on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 12.1</u></b>,
those as to which the lease, maintenance and support costs are included in the
Kraft Base Case, and all other leases as to which Supplier received reasonable
notice and/or reasonable access prior to the Commencement Date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>EU</b>&#148; shall mean the European Union.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Expected Service Level Default</b>&#148; shall mean the Supplier&#146;s
level of performance for a particular Critical Service Level that fails to meet
the applicable Expected Service Level (but does not fail to meet the applicable
Minimum Service Level) as specified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.1</u></b>
and has failed to meet such Expected Service Level for <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
in any rolling 12-month period for Critical Service Levels with a monthly
Measurement Window, or has failed to meet the Expected Service Level in any period
for Critical Service Levels with a quarterly, semi-annual or annual Measurement
Window.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">7</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Expected Service Level</b>&#148; shall mean the desired level of
current year performance for a Critical Service Level, as set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>External Storage Media</b>&#148; shall mean any
non-fixed-disk based storage media, including tape, optical disk, and CD.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Extraordinary Event</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 11.6.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>FTE Rate</b>&#148; means, in relation to each FTE, the hourly and
monthly rates specified, and designated as &#147;Mantime Rates&#148;, in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.1</u></b> for a particular skill
category or position, for onshore and offshore personnel, as identified on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.1</u></b> and adjusted pursuant
to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 12(c)</u></b> of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>FTE Services</b>&#148;
means Projects or New Services that Kraft requests to be provided by FTEs or
FTPs on a FTE Rate basis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Full Time Equivalent</b>&#148; or &#147;<b>FTE</b>&#148;
means the full time equivalent work effort charged on an hourly basis. Supplier
shall not charge Kraft for more than <b>&#160;*&#160;
*&#160; *</b> hours per month
for one (1) individual&#146;s work effort in a month.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Full Time Person</b>&#148; or &#147;<b>FTP</b>&#148; shall mean
a level of effort of a full time individual that would result in at least <b>&#160;*&#160; *&#160; *</b>
productive hours per month, excluding vacation, holidays, training,
administrative and other non-productive time (but including a reasonable amount
of additional work outside normal business hours). Without Kraft&#146;s prior
written approval, one dedicated individual&#146;s total work effort cannot amount to
more than one FTE.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Hard IMAC</b>&#148;
shall mean</font> an approved
IMAC request received from Kraft, which requires Supplier to dispatch a
technician to the affected Kraft Site or Authorized User&#146;s location in order to
perform such required IMAC. A Hard IMAC will include a Soft IMAC, if necessary.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Help Desk</b>&#148;
shall mean</font> the
facilities, associated technologies, and trained staff who respond to Calls,
coordinate all Problem Management and Request Management activities and act as
a single point of contact for Authorized Users in regard to the Services.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>High
Availability Configurations</b>&#148; are Server Systems designed to either
automatically or manually switch to the fail-over system when a system failure
occurs. The fail over system can be in either the same data center or a
separate facility.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>IMAC(s)</b>&#148;
shall mean</font> installations,
moves, adds, changes, de-installations, and cascades for Equipment, Software
and related services at designated Kraft Sites. The repair of Equipment or
Software is not an IMAC, even when repair entails a physical visit to a System.
Types of IMACs include Hard IMACs, Soft IMACs, Data IMACs, EUC IMACs, Voice
IMACs, and Project IMACs.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Income Tax</b>&#148; shall mean any tax on or measured by the net
income of a Party (including taxes on capital or net worth, or gross receipts
that are imposed as an alternative to a tax based on net or gross income), or
taxes which are of the nature of excess profits tax, minimum tax on tax
preferences, alternative minimum tax, accumulated earnings tax, personal
holding company tax, and capital gains tax.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Indirect Goods and Services</b>&#148; shall mean those goods and
services that are purchased by Kraft, consumed directly by Kraft, and not
utilized in Kraft&#146;s provision of its services to its customers. Such</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">8</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">goods and services
include, for example: travel; office supplies and equipment; maintenance,
repair, and operating supplies/MRO; advertising and marketing services;
contract labor; and desktop IT equipment.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Interconnect
Devices</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the devices used to enable a portion of the Network to connect with
another portion of the Network, in either a dedicated or dialup mode (e.g.,
modems, bridges, routers, hubs, switches, gateways).</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Interest Rate&#148;</b> shall mean the lesser of (i) the prime
commercial rate plus two percent per annum as announced from time to time by
Citibank, N.A., and (ii) the highest lawful rate of interest.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Invoice Date</b>&#148; shall mean the date the vendor invoice is
received.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>ITIL</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
9.4.1.8</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Key Measurements</b>&#148; shall mean those Service Levels for which
no Service Level Credit is payable, but which are meaningful to Kraft&#146;s
business and are described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Key Supplier Personnel</b>&#148; shall mean the Supplier Personnel
filling the positions designated in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 5.4</u></b>
as Key Supplier Personnel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the preamble to this
Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Base Case</b>&#148; shall mean the summary financial base case
attached hereto as <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.3</u></b>,
as well as the detailed financial and budget information underlying such
summary base case. The Kraft Base Case shall not be used to determine whether
either Party has financial or operational responsibility for any particular
Third Party Contract, or to establish the volume of any assets or Resource
Units.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Baseline</b>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4</u></b>, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
16(b)</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft
Business Call Center</b>&#148; shall mean a department or group that handles
telephone calls and inquiries that are related to a particular business
function and is staffed by personnel, including Kraft Personnel or third party
personnel. PBX and adjunct systems are usually used to facilitate customer
calls, and also to provide reports and metrics to determine both individual and
group effectiveness. Kraft Business Call Centers include: Benefits/HR Call
Center, Consumer Response Call Center, and Accounts Payable Call Center and are
listed as of the Effective Date in Attachment 2.4-B of Schedule 2.4.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Contract Manager</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 10.1.</u></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Data</b>&#148; shall mean any data or information of Kraft or
any Eligible Recipient that is provided to or obtained by Supplier in
connection with the negotiation and execution of this Agreement or the
performance of Supplier&#146;s obligations under this Agreement, including data and
information with respect to the businesses, customer, operations, facilities,
products, rates, regulatory compliance, competitors, consumer markets, assets,
expenditures, mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, billings, collections,
revenues and finances of Kraft or any Eligible Recipient. Kraft Data also shall
mean any data or information that is (i) derived or compiled from data or
information provided by or on behalf of Kraft or the Eligible Recipients, (ii)
created, collected for Kraft or the Eligible Recipients by Supplier in the
performance of its obligations under this Agreement, including data processing
input and output, service level measurements, asset information, Reports, Kraft
third party service and product agreements, contract charges, and Retained
Expense and Pass-Through Expenses or (ii) that resides in or is accessed
through Software, Equipment or Systems provided, operated, supported, or used
by Supplier in connection with</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">9</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the Services, as
well as information derived from this data and information; provided that the
foregoing shall not include data on shared Systems located in Supplier
Facilities to the extent such data pertains to services Supplier provides to
its other customers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Facilities</b>&#148; shall mean the facilities listed in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 7.1</u></b> that are provided by
Kraft or the Eligible Recipient for the use of Supplier to the extent necessary
to provide the Services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Laws</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 15.10.4</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft-Owned Materials</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 14.1.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft-Owned Software</b>&#148; shall mean Software owned by Kraft, a
Kraft Affiliate or an Eligible Recipient and used, operated, maintained or
supported by or on behalf of Supplier under or in connection with this
Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Personal Data</b>&#148; shall mean that portion of Kraft Data
that is subject to any Privacy Laws.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Personnel</b>&#148; shall mean the employees, agents,
contractors or representatives of Altria, its Affiliates, Kraft or any Eligible
Recipients who performed any of the Services to be provided by Supplier during
the 18 months preceding the Commencement Date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Rules</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 6.3.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Sites</b>&#148; or &#147;<b>Sites</b>&#148; shall
mean the offices or other facilities, including those listed on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 7</u></b> at or to which Supplier
is to provide the Services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Standards</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.5.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Kraft Third Party Contractors</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given
in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.5</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>LAN</b>&#148;
or &#147;<b>Local Area Network</b>&#148; shall mean</font> a local, high-speed Network, consisting of
LAN Equipment, Software, Transport Systems, Interconnect Devices, Wiring and
Cabling, which are used to create, connect and transmit data, voice and video
signals to, within or among Kraft&#146;s local area network segments. LANs are
typically confined within limited geographic areas (such as a single building
or group of buildings) and offer relatively high data rates, usually 10/100
mbps or above. LANs typically interconnect End User PCs, local servers, and
printers and may connect with WANs. LANs do not include telecommunication
circuits provided by carriers, however LANs can be inter-connected using
telecommunication circuits provided as a result of MAN or WAN Services, so as
to appear as a single LAN.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>LAN
Equipment</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the Equipment and associated attachments, features, accessories, and
peripherals supported or used by Supplier in connection with its provision of
LAN Services to the Authorized Users (e.g., bridges, intelligent and non
intelligent hubs, switches, gateways, remote access devices, and associated
diagnostic equipment), and all additions, modifications, substitutions,
Upgrades or enhancements to such Equipment. LAN Equipment does not include
telecommunication circuits provided by telecommunications carriers, however LAN
Equipment can be inter-connected using telecommunication circuits provided by
carriers and MAN and or WAN Equipment, so as to appear as one LAN.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">10</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Laws</b>&#148; shall mean all federal, state, provincial, regional,
territorial and local laws, statutes, ordinances, regulations, rules, executive
orders, supervisory requirements, directives, circulars, opinions, interpretive
letters and other official releases of or by any government, or any authority,
department or agency thereof, including the United States Securities and
Exchange Commission and the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board. The
definition of Laws shall include Privacy Laws. For purposes of this Agreement,
Laws also shall include all generally accepted accounting principles of the
United States (&#147;<b>GAAP</b>&#148;), as such principles and
standards may be modified during the Term by the Financial Accounting Standards
Board or other applicable authorities. In addition, any other laws in force in
any jurisdiction (regulatory or otherwise) in which the Services are being
provided.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Level 1
Support</b>&#148; </font>shall
mean support that is provided as the entry point for inquiries or problem
reports from Authorized Users. If Level 1 Support personnel cannot resolve the
inquiry or problem, the inquiry or problem will be directed to the appropriate
Level 2 Support personnel or third party for resolution.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Level 2
Support</b>&#148; </font>shall
mean support that serves as a consolidation point for inquiries and problems
between Level 1 Support and Level 3 Support. For example, Level 2 Support might
exist in a computer operations or a distribution/mail out center. If Level 2 Support
personnel cannot resolve the inquiry or problem, the inquiry or problem will be
directed to the appropriate Level 3 Support personnel or third party for
resolution.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Level 3
Support</b>&#148; </font>shall
mean support provided by the personnel or third party that is most
knowledgeable about the underlying problem or question and is utilized when
efforts to resolve the problem or question by Level 1 Support and Level 2
Support have failed or are bypassed due to the technical difficulty of the
problem or question. Inquiries or problems for Level 3 Support&#160; generally will be reported by Level 1 Support
or Level 2 Support personnel, but may be also initiated directly by Authorized
Users or Supplier.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Litigation Data</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 13.6.3.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Litigation Requirements Notice</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given
in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 13.6.3.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Litigation Response Plan</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 13.6.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Losses</b>&#148; shall mean all losses, liabilities, damages
(including punitive and exemplary damages), fines, penalties, interest and
claims (including taxes), and all related costs and expenses (including
reasonable legal fees and disbursements and costs of investigation, litigation,
experts, settlement, judgment, interest and penalties).</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mainframe</b>&#148;
shall mean</font> a Server that
utilizes the VM, Z/OS, OS 390, or TPF operating software.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Maintenance Downtime</b>&#148; shall mean the period of time that a
particular System, Application, Software, Equipment, Network, or any other part
of the Services is not available during the Measurement Windows&#160; that have been approved (i) in writing by the
Kraft Contract Manager or a designee thereof or (ii) pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Major Release</b>&#148; shall mean a new version of Software that
includes changes to the architecture and/or adds new features and functionality
in addition to the original functional characteristics of the preceding
Software release. These releases are usually identified by full integer changes
in the numbering, such as from &#147;<b>7.0</b>&#148; to &#147;<b>8.0</b>,&#148; but may be identified by the industry as a major
release without the accompanying integer change.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">11</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Malicious Code</b>&#148; shall mean (i) any code, program, or
sub-program whose knowing or intended purpose is to damage or interfere with
the operation of the computer system containing the code, program or
sub-program, or to halt, disable or interfere with the operation of the
Software, code, program, or sub-program, itself; (ii) any device, method, or
token that permits any person to circumvent the normal security of the Software
or the system containing the code; or (iii) any adware, spyware, Internet bots,
malware, bugs, web bugs or other surreptitious code.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>MAN or Metropolitan Area Network</b>&#148; shall
mean a high-speed Network consisting of&nbsp;MAN Equipment, Software, Transport
Systems, and Interconnect Devices that&nbsp;are used to create, connect and
transmit data, voice and video signals between&nbsp;locations&nbsp;within a
metropolitan region or area.&nbsp;MANs cover an area larger than a LAN but
smaller than WANs.&nbsp; MAN services are typically provisioned by a third-party.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>MAN Equipment</b>&#148; shall mean the Equipment
and associated attachments, features, accessories, peripherals and Cabling
supported or used by Supplier in connection with its provision of&nbsp;MAN
Services to the Authorized Users (e.g.,&nbsp;multiplexors, access circuits,
backbone circuits, channel banks, CSU/DSUs, and associated diagnostic
equipment), and all additions, modifications, substitutions, Upgrades or
enhancements to such Equipment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Managed Telecom Transport Agreements</b>&#148; shall have the meaning
given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.11.5</u></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Managed Telecom Transport Providers</b>&#148; shall have the meaning
given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.11.5</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Managed Third Parties</b>&#148; shall mean the Kraft Third Party
Contractors and Managed Telecom Transport Providers (as defined in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.11.5</u></b>), identified on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedules 11</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">12</u></b>, as such Schedules may be
amended from time to time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Management Tools</b>&#148; shall mean all Software that is used to
deliver and manage the Services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Materials</b>&#148; shall mean, collectively, Software, literary
works, other works of authorship, specifications, designs, analyses, processes,
methodologies, concepts, inventions, know-how,&#160;
programs, program listings, programming tools, documentation, user
materials, reports, drawings, databases, spreadsheets, machine-readable text
and files and financial models, whether tangible or intangible.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Measurement Window</b>&#148; shall mean the time during, or frequency
by, which a Service Level shall be measured. The Measurement Window will
exclude Kraft approved scheduled maintenance and Maintenance Downtime.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Minimum Service Level Default</b>&#148; shall mean the Supplier&#146;s
performance for a particular Critical Service Level fails to meet the
applicable Minimum Service Level at any time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Minimum Service Level(s)</b>&#148; shall mean the minimum level of
performance set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.1</u></b>
with respect to each Critical Service Level and Key Measurement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Minor Release</b>&#148; shall mean a scheduled release containing
small functionality updates and/or accumulated resolutions to defects or
non-conformances made available since the immediately preceding release
(whether Major Release or Minor Release). Minor Releases shall include &#147;<b>Maintenance Releases</b>&#148; which are supplemental to and made
available between Major Releases and other Minor Releases, issued and provided
under specific vendor service level or maintenance obligations and contain</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">12</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">only accumulated
resolutions&#160; or mandated changes. These
releases are usually identified by a change in the decimal numbering of a
release, such as &#147;<b>7.12</b>&#148; to &#147;<b>7.13</b>.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mobile
Data Communications Equipment</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the Equipment and associated attachments,
features, accessories, and peripherals supported or used by Supplier in
connection with its provision of Mobile Data Communications Services to the
Authorized Users (e.g., wireless modems, wireless access points (&#147;<b>WAPs</b>&#148;), mobile data terminals, or other devices that may be
mounted in vehicles either permanently or detachable for portability used to
deliver Mobile Data Communication Network Services, and associated diagnostic
equipment), and all additions, modifications, substitutions, Upgrades or
enhancements to such Equipment.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mobile
Data Communications Network</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the wireless portion of Kraft&#146;s Network
consisting of Mobile Data Communications Equipment, Software, Transport
Systems, Interconnect Devices, Wiring and Cabling used to create, connect and
transmit data to and from Mobile Data Communications Equipment via mobile IP
network roaming services.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mobile Data Communications Services</b>&#148;
shall mean the mobile Services as described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
2.4</u></b> (Managed Network Services).</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mobile
Data Communications System</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the Mobile Data Communications Equipment
supported or used by Supplier in connection with its provision of Mobile Data
Communications Services.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mobile
Short Messaging Equipment</b>&#148; or <b>&#147;MSM
Equipment</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the Equipment and associated attachments, features, accessories, and
peripherals supported or used by Supplier in connection with its provision of
Mobile Short Messaging Services to the Authorized Users (pagers, paging
transmitters, and Portable Network Devices and associated diagnostic equipment)
and all additions, modifications, substitutions, Upgrades or enhancements to
such Equipment.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mobile
Short Messaging Network</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the portion of the Network consisting of
Mobile Short Messaging Equipment, Software, Transport Systems, Interconnect
Devices, and Cabling used to create, connect and transmit data to Authorized
Users.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Monthly Base Charge</b>&#148; means, with respect to each Tower, the
amount specified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.1,</u></b>
as adjusted pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Sections 6(e)</u></b>
and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">12(c)</u></b> of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
4</u></b>, for that Tower in the applicable time period specified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Monthly Invoice</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 12.1.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>N Release Level</b>&#148; shall mean the most
recently released and generally available Major Release of the Software.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>N-1 Release Level</b>&#148; shall mean the next
to most recently released and generally available Major Release of the
Software.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>N-2 Release Level</b>&#148; shall mean the next
to most recently released and generally available Major Release prior to N-1
Release Level.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Network</b>&#148;
shall mean</font> collectively,
Kraft&#146;s Transport Services, WAN, MAN, BAN, LAN, Standard Voice Network, and
conferencing Network.</p>
