<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>New Advances</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.17.5</u></b><u>.</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>New Services</b>&#148; shall mean services, functions, processes and
responsibilities &nbsp;(i) that are <b>&#160;*&#160;
*&#160; *</b> the Services
(which may include changes in <b>&#160;*&#160;
*&#160; *</b> the Services are
performed), (ii) that require&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; *</b> of effort or resources then
being used or expenses then being incurred by Supplier to provide the Services,
and (iii) for which there is no <b>&#160;*&#160;
*&#160; *</b>or <b>&#160;*&#160; *&#160; *</b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Non-Billable Projects</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.6.4.1</u></b>..</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Notice of Arbitration</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.3.3.</u></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Notice of Election</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 17.5.1.</u></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Notice of Mediation</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 19.2.3.</u></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Out-of-Pocket Expenses</b>&#148; shall mean reasonable, demonstrable
and actual out-of-pocket expenses due and payable to a third party by Supplier
that are approved in advance by Kraft and for which Supplier is entitled to be
reimbursed by Kraft under this Agreement. Out-of-Pocket Expenses shall not
include Supplier&#146;s overhead costs (or allocations thereof), general and/or
administrative expenses or other mark-ups. Out-of-Pocket Expenses shall be
calculated at Supplier&#146;s actual incremental expense and shall be net of all
rebates and allowances.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Party&#148; and &#147;Parties&#148;</b> shall have the meaning given in the
preamble to this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Pass-Through Expenses</b>&#148; shall mean the types of expenses, if
any, listed in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedules 4.2</u></b>
or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">&#160;4.7</u></b>,
as such list may be amended by Kraft from time to time, for which Kraft has
agreed in advance to be financially responsible, in accordance with <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 11</u></b> of this Agreement,
following processing and review of the third party invoice by Supplier.
Supplier shall not separately charge any handling or administrative charge in
connection with its processing or review of such invoices.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Performance Category</b>&#148; shall mean a grouping of&#160; Service Levels as set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.1</u></b>. Critical Deliverables
do not constitute a Performance Category.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#147;<b>Personnel Projection
Matrix</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
8.1.6</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Policy and Procedures Manual</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given
in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.1.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Pool Percentage Available for Allocation</b>&#148; shall have the
meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Portable
Network Devices</b>&#148; shall mean</font> portable, hand-held Equipment used by Authorized Users for
telecommunications access and services devices, as listed in
Attachment&nbsp;2.4-A of Schedule 2.4, where such list may be updated from time
to time by Kraft after a review of the update has gone through Change Control
Procedures in accordance with <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section&nbsp;9.6</u></b>
of the Agreement. Portable Network Devices do not include personal computers or
laptops.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Principles</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 8.3.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Priority</b>&#148; shall mean the
classification of a problem or incident as recorded in the Problem Tracking
System. Priority shall be set at one of P1, P2, P3, or P4.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">14</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-27.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:51 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#147;Priority
1&#148;</font></b> or &#147;P1&#148; shall mean that a problem or incident has a critical degree of
business impact and shall refer to a major system, product, or component
failure that impacts level of service and affects a major function of the
business, as a result of which the business is unable to function until the
failure is resolved.&nbsp; Problems or incidents involving a single user&#146;s
system or access will not be considered a Priority 1, except for those systems
or access identified as plant floor equipment.&nbsp; Desktops and laptops may
not generate P1 problems, with the exception of the Kraft designated plant
floor desktops and laptops (which may generate P1 problems) that Supplier has
agreed may generate P1 problems.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.<b>&#148;Priority 2&#148;</b> or &#147;P2&#148; shall mean that a problem or incident
has a high degree of business impact and shall refer to a problem or incident
that impacts the business&#146; ability to complete daily work and therefore affects
daily level of service, as a result of which the business is able to perform
and function with either a workaround or manual processes but service is
degraded.&nbsp; Desktops and laptops may not generate P2 problems, with the
exception of the Kraft designated plant floor desktops and laptops (which may
generate P2 problems) that Supplier has agreed may generate P2 problems.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#147;Priority
3&#148;</font></b> or &#147;P3&#148; shall mean that a problem or incident has a medium
degree of business impact and shall refer to a problem or incident that results
in limited loss of function, during which work can be completed using alternative
methods and there is no impact to daily levels of service, and as a result of
which the business can continue to function even though service may be
degraded.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#147;Priority
4&#148;</font></b> or &#147;P4&#148; shall mean that a problem or incident has a low
degree of business impact and shall refer to a minor issue or request which has
no impact on daily level of service and requires follow-up only.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Privacy Laws</b>&#148; means Laws that relate to the security and
protection of personally identifiable information, data privacy, trans-border
data flow or data protection, including the Health Insurance Portability and
Accountability Act (HIPAA), the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act and the implementing
legislation and regulations of the European Union member states under the
European Union Directive 95/46/EC.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Problem
Management</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the process of tracking and managing all problems arising in Kraft&#146;s
information technology (&#147;<b>IT</b>&#148;)
environment and recorded in the Problem Tracking System, and resolving those
problems arising from or related to the Services.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;</font><b>Problem Tracking System</b>&#148; shall mean the functionality and technical characteristics of the system
described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2.1</u></b><u> (Cross
Functional &#150; General Services)</u>.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Procurement
Catalog</b>&#148; shall mean</font> a list of Equipment and Software that are the approved products for
purchase or lease by Authorized Users. The Procurement Catalog may include the
provision of Services and also products purchased by Authorized Users as
Pass-Through Expenses.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Projects</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.6.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Project
IMAC</b>&#148; </font>shall
mean a combination of ten or more IMACs that occur within the same building or
locale or some other similar requirements or timeframe that requires more than
routine scheduling of personnel to deliver this group of IMACs in a coordinated
manner. These types of requests typically involve a coordinated movement of
multiple Equipment in order to minimize the impact to the end users. Supplier
will work with Kraft to schedule these IMACs and&#160; provide a written plan for Project IMACs as
described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.3.1</u></b>
of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2.5</u></b><u> (End User Computing Services</u>).
IMACS that have similar requirements that may require EDS to perform a Project
may be submitted to EDS as described in the</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Agreement. Project IMACS will be performed according to the schedule in
the written plan for Project IMACS or a Project plan, as approved by Kraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Proprietary Information</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 13.4.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Quality Assurance</b>&#148; means the actions, planned and performed,
to provide confidence that all business processes, Systems, Equipment, Software
and components that influence the quality of the Services are working as
expected individually and collectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Reduced Resource Credit(s)</b>&#148; or &#147;<b>RRC(s)</b>&#148;
means, for any Billable Resource Unit, the incremental credit payable by
Supplier to Kraft based on the amount by which the Actual Volumes of Billable
Resource Units is below<b> </b>the Resource
Baseline for such Billable Resource Unit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Reports</b>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.2.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Request
Management</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the process of tracking and managing all requests from Authorized
Users arising in Kraft&#146;s information technology environment recorded on the
Request Management System, and resolving those requests arising from or related
to the Services.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Request Management
System</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the functionality and technical characteristics of the System
described in Section&nbsp;3.0 (Request Management) of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
2.1</u></b><u> (Cross Functional &#151; General Services)</u>.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Required Consents</b>&#148; shall mean the consents (if any) required
to be obtained: (i) to assign or transfer to Supplier Kraft licensed Third
Party Software, Third Party Contracts, Equipment Leases or Acquired Assets
(including related warranties); (ii) to grant Supplier the right to use and/or
access the Kraft licensed Third Party Software in connection with providing the
Services; (iii) to grant Kraft and the Eligible Recipients the right to use
and/or access the Supplier Owned Software, Third Party Software and Equipment
acquired, operated, supported or used by Supplier in connection with providing
the Services; (iv) to change location of the installation or use of any
Software, Equipment or System (including consents to offshore use) or change
the permitted use thereof by Supplier; (v) except for Developed Materials that
are owned by Supplier pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 14</u></b>,
to assign or transfer to Kraft, the Eligible Recipients or their designee(s)
any Developed Materials; (vi) to assign or transfer to Kraft, the Eligible
Recipients or their designee(s) Supplier Owned Software, Third Party Software,
Third Party Contracts, Equipment leases or other rights following the Term to
the extent provided in this Agreement; and (vii) all other consents required
from third parties in connection with Supplier&#146;s provision of the Services or
performance of its obligations hereunder.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Resolvable Calls</b>&#148; shall mean those Calls that would be
possible to solve at first level, either through existing knowledge, transfer
of knowledge, or process changes. This does not include Calls that require
dispatch or transfer to another group for resolution.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Resource Baselines</b>&#148; shall mean the estimated number of
Resource Units applicable to a defined period of time and included in the
Monthly Base Charges. The Resource Baselines as of the Commencement Date are
set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4</u></b>, and may be
adjusted in accordance with Section 6 of Schedule 4. The Resource Baselines may
also be revised from time to time by agreement of the Parties based on the
usage, demand and business requirements of Kraft and the Eligible Recipients
and the Monthly Base Charges will be adjusted accordingly.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Resource Baseline Band(s)</b>&#148; means the volume bands (or, where
applicable, the multiple volume bands) represented as percentages above and
below the Resource Baseline. Each Resource Baseline Band has</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">16</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-29.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:52 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">unique ARC Rates
and RRC Rates, as set forth on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.1</u>,</b>
that shall apply to the volume of Billable Resource Units that fall within that
Resource Baseline Band. Unless otherwise indicated on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
4.5</u></b>, the Resource Baseline Band for each Resource Unit, other
than the Resource Units designated in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.5</u></b>
as not being subject to Resource Baseline Bands, will be&#160; <b>*&#160; *&#160; * </b>%
above and <b>&#160;*&#160; *&#160; * </b>%
below the Resource Baseline for that Resource Unit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Resource Unit(s)</b>&#148; means a particular unit of service
delivery resources. Each Resource Unit is either a &#147;Non-Billable Asset&#148; or a &#147;Billable
Resource Unit&#148; as indicated on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.5</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Retained Systems and Business Processes</b>&#148; means those systems
and business processes of Kraft or an Eligible Recipient for which Supplier has
not assumed responsibility under this Agreement (including those provided,
managed, operated, supported and/or used on their behalf by Kraft Third Party
Contractors). Retained Systems and Business Processes include equipment and
software associated with such systems and business processes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Root Cause Analysis</b>&#148; shall mean the formal process,
specified in the Policy and Procedures Manual, to be used by Supplier to
diagnose the underlying cause of problems at the lowest reasonable level so
that corrective action can be taken that will eliminate repeat failures.
Supplier shall implement a Root Cause Analysis in accordance with the Service
Levels.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>RRC Rate</b>&#148; means, in relation to each Billable Resource Unit,
the amount specified as the &#147;RRC Rate&#148; for that Billable Resource Unit on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.1</u></b>, as adjusted pursuant
to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 12</u></b> of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
4</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>SAS 70 Audit</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.10.9.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>SAS 70 Report</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.10.9.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Scheduled Downtime</b>&#148; shall mean that period of time during
which a particular System, Application, Software, Equipment, Network or any
other part of the Services is expected not to be available during the
Measurement Window.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Scheduled Uptime</b>&#148; shall mean that period of time during
which a particular System, Application, Software, Equipment, Network or any
other part of the Services is expected to be available during the Measurement
Window.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>SDBs</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
9.13.3</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Self Service Tools</b>&#148; shall mean tools
and processes that allow an Authorized User to obtain Service or remediate a
problem without the direct intervention of Supplier.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Server</b>&#148;
shall mean</font> any computer,
but excluding desktops and laptops acting as a server, that provides shared processing
or resources such as printer, fax, Application processing, database, mail,
proxy, firewalls, and backup capabilities to Authorized Users or other
computers over the Network. A Server includes the operating system, associated
peripherals, such as local storage devices, attachments to centralized storage,
monitor, keyboard, pointing device, tape drives and external disk arrays (but
not desktops and laptops), and is identified by a unique manufacturer&#146;s serial
number.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Server Instances</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.5</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Service Entitlement</b>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3.2</u></b>, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
1.5.4</u></b>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">17</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-29.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:52 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Service Level(s)</b>&#148; shall mean, individually and collectively,
the quantitative performance standards for the Services set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Service Level Credit Allocation Percentage</b>&#148; shall mean the
percentage of the Allocation of Pool Percentage allocated to a Critical Service
Level within a Performance Category.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Service Level Credits</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 7.2</u></b> and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 3</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Service Level Default</b>&#148; shall mean a Minimum Service Level
Default or an Expected Service Level Default.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Service Target</b>&#148; shall
mean a performance level to which (i) a particular service element is to be
delivered and (ii) Supplier&#146;s solution is to be architected and designed to
deliver. Service Targets are not measured for Service Level purposes, however
may be reported by Supplier in accordance with <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.1</u></b> of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
3.0 Service Targets</u></b> are listed in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule&nbsp;3.1&nbsp;(Service Levels Matrix)</u></b><u>.</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Service Taxes</b>&#148; shall mean all sales, use, transaction based
gross receipts, excise, provincial, value added, COFINS, ISS and PIS and other
similar taxes that are assessed against either Party on the final provision of
the Services as a whole, or on any particular Service received by Kraft or an
Eligible Recipient from Supplier, excluding Income Taxes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Services</b>&#148; shall mean, collectively: (i) the services,
functions and responsibilities described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 4</u></b>
and elsewhere in this Agreement (including Transition Services, Transformation
Services and Termination Assistance Services) as they may be supplemented,
enhanced, modified or replaced during the Term in accordance with this
Agreement; and (ii) any ongoing Projects required to be performed as specifically
described in this Agreement and any new Projects upon Kraft&#146;s acceptance of
Supplier&#146;s proposals for such Projects in accordance with <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
4.6</u></b> and the other provisions of this Agreement; and (iii) any
New Services, upon Kraft&#146;s acceptance of Supplier&#146;s proposal for such New
Services in accordance with <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 11.5</u></b>
and the other provisions of this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Shared Subcontractors</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.12.3</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>SMC</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
9.10.9.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Soft IMAC</b>&#148;
shall mean</font> an approved
Soft IMAC request received from Kraft, which IMAC can be performed concurrently
with remote element management tools and does not require any physical on-site
intervention. A Software patch or error correction upgrade will not be considered
as a Soft IMAC, but is included in the Services.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Software</b>&#148; shall mean all software programs and programming
(and all modifications, replacements, Upgrades, enhancements, documentation,
materials and media related thereto), to the extent a Party has financial or
operational responsibility for such programs or programming in connection with
the Services, including under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2</u></b>,
<b><u style="font-weight:bold;">4.2</u></b>, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">11</u></b>
or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">12</u></b>. Software shall include all such
programs or programming in use or required to be used as of the Commencement
Date, including those set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 11</u></b>,
those as to which the license, maintenance or support costs are included in the
Kraft Base Case, and those as to which Supplier received reasonable notice
and/or access prior to the Commencement Date. Software also shall include all
such programs or programming developed and/or introduced by or for Kraft or the
Eligible Recipients on or after the Commencement Date to the extent a Party has
financial or operational responsibility for such programs or programming under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2</u></b>, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">4.2</u></b>,
<b><u style="font-weight:bold;">11</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">12</u></b>.
Software includes all Applications, Development Tools, Management Tools and
Systems Software.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">18</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Specialized Services</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.9.1</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Specifications</b>&#148; shall mean, with respect to business
processes, Software, Equipment, Systems or other contract deliverables to be
designed, developed, delivered, integrated, installed and/or tested by
Supplier, the technical, design and/or functional specifications set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">8</u></b>,
in third party vendor documentation, in a New Services or Project description
requested and/or approved by Kraft, or otherwise agreed upon in writing by the
Parties.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Standard
Products</b>&#148; shall mean</font> EUC Equipment and Software requirements and/or specific EUC Equipment
and Software that are designated as being in standard use within Kraft.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Standard
Voice Network</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the portion of the Network consisting of Standard Voice Premise
Systems, Software, Transport Systems, Interconnect Devices, and Cabling used to
create, connect and transmit voice to Authorized Users.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Standard
Voice Premise Equipment</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the Equipment and associated attachments,
features, accessories, and peripherals supported or used by Supplier in
connection with its provision of standard voice Services to the Authorized
Users, including PBXs and PBX rectifiers, handsets, key systems, voice mail
systems, and paging systems, American Disabilities Act (&#147;ADA&#148;) communications
devices (e.g., TDDs, teletype, special equipped handsets), voice communications
management systems, backup battery systems, and associated diagnostic
equipment.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Standard
Voice Premise Systems</b>&#148; shall mean</font> all Standard Voice Premise Equipment and
associated Software supported or used by Supplier in connection with its
provision of standard voice Services.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Strategic Plan</b>&#148; shall mean the plans that may be
periodically developed by Kraft that set forth Kraft&#146;s key business objectives
and requirements and outline its strategies for achieving such objectives and
requirements. Kraft may revise the Strategic Plan from time to time. The
Strategic Plan will include both annual and multi-year strategies, objectives
and requirements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the preamble to
this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Subcontractors</b>&#148; shall mean subcontractors (of any tier) of
Supplier, including Shared Subcontractors (as defined in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
9.12.3</u></b>)<b>. </b>The initial
list of Subcontractors is set forth on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 19</u></b>,
each of which has been approved by Kraft to the extent such approval is
required and described thereon. <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 19</u></b>
may be amended during the Term in accordance with <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
9.12</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier Account Executive</b>&#148; shall mean the Supplier
representative responsible for both the day-to-day relationship with Kraft as
well as the delivery of all Services to Kraft, as further described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 8.5</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier Facilities</b>&#148; shall mean, individually and
collectively, the facilities owned or leased by Supplier (or its Affiliates or
Subcontractors) from which Supplier (or its Affiliates or Subcontractors) provides
any Services. Supplier Facilities are listed on <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
7.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier Laws</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 15.10.4</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier Overhead Functions</b>&#148; means Supplier&#146;s overhead
functions and activities, including those described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
11</u></b> of <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4</u></b>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">19</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-29.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:52 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier Overhead Materials</b>&#148; means for third party products
that are used by Supplier to perform its internal functions and which are not
directly used to provide the Services and for which Kraft does not have any
reimbursement or payment obligation either during the Term or upon any
termination of this Agreement. For avoidance of doubt, these are items such as
Supplier Personnel&#146;s personal computers and associated software, and Supplier&#146;s
internal accounting systems and internal database software which Kraft would
not need to enable it to provide the Services for itself.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier Owned Materials</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 14.3.1.</u></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier Owned Software</b>&#148; shall mean any Software owned by
Supplier and used to provide the Services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Supplier Personnel</b>&#148; shall mean those employees,
representatives, contractor personnel, subcontractor personnel and agents of
Supplier, Subcontractors and Supplier Affiliates who perform any Services under
this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>System</b>&#148; shall mean an interconnected grouping of manual or
electronic processes, including Equipment, Software and associated attachments,
features, accessories, peripherals and cabling, and all additions,
modifications, substitutions, Upgrades or enhancements to such System, to the extent
a Party has financial or operational responsibility for such System or System
components under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2</u></b>.
System shall include all Systems in use or required to be used as of the
Commencement Date, all additions, modifications, substitutions, Upgrades or
enhancements to such Systems and all Systems installed or developed by or for
Kraft, the Eligible Recipients or Supplier following the Commencement Date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Systems Software</b>&#148; shall mean all Software that perform tasks
basic to the functioning of the Equipment and are required to operate the
Applications Software or otherwise support the provision of Services by
Supplier, including operating systems, systems utilities, data security
software, compilers, performance monitoring and testing tools and database
managers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Target Baselines</b>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4</u></b>, <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section
16(b)</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Tax Authority</b>&#148; shall mean any federal, state, provincial,
regional, territorial, local or other fiscal, revenue, customs or excise
authority, body or official competent to impose, collect or assess tax.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Technological Evolution</b>&#148; means any improvement, upgrade,
addition, modification, replacement, or enhancement to the standards, policies,
practices, processes, procedures, methods, controls, scripts, product information,
technologies, architectures, standards, Applications, Equipment, Software,
Systems, tools, products, transport systems, interfaces and personnel skills
associated with the performance of information technology services and related
functions in line with the established best practices of first-tier providers
of such services, as determined by Kraft. Technological Evolution includes: (i)
higher capacity, further scaling and commercializing of business processes,
more efficient and scalable business processes, new versions and types of
applications and systems/network software, new business or IT processes, and
new types of hardware and communications equipment that will enable Supplier to
perform the Services more efficiently and effectively as well as enable Kraft
and the Eligible Recipients to meet and support their business requirements and
strategies and (ii) any change to the Equipment, Software or methodologies used
to provide the Services that is necessary to bring that function,&#160; Equipment or Software or those methodologies
into line with the Kraft Standards and/or current industry standards.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Technology Plan</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 9.5.5.</u></b></font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">20</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-29.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:52 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Term</b>&#148; shall mean the period commencing on the Effective Date
and continuing until the expiration or termination of this Agreement, including
the termination of all Services (except Termination Assistance Services).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Termination Assistance Services</b>&#148; shall mean the
termination/expiration assistance requested by Kraft to allow the Services to continue
without interruption or adverse effect and to facilitate the orderly transfer
of the Services to Kraft or its designee, as such assistance is further
described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.4</u></b> and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 23</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Termination Charges</b>&#148; shall mean the termination charges set
forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.6</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Third Party Contracts</b>&#148; shall mean all agreements between
third parties and Kraft, an Eligible Recipient or Supplier that have been or
will be used to provide the Services to the extent a Party has financial or
operational responsibility for such contracts under <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule
2</u></b> or <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.2</u></b>.
Third Party Contracts shall include all such agreements in effect as of the
Commencement Date, including those contracts identified in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedules
12.1</u></b> and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">12.2</u></b>, those
as to which the costs are included in the Kraft Base Case, and those as to
which Supplier received reasonable notice and/or reasonable access prior to
the&#160; Commencement Date. Third Party
Contracts also shall include those third party agreements entered into by
Supplier following the Commencement Date which Supplier uses to provide the
Services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Third Party</b>  <b>Litigation</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 13.6.4</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Third Party Materials</b>&#148; shall mean intellectual property,
Third Party Software or other Materials that are owned by third parties and
provided under license to Supplier (or its Affiliates or Subcontractors) or
Kraft (or the Eligible Recipients) and that have been or will be used to
provide or receive the Services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Third Party Software</b>&#148; shall mean all Software that is provided
under license or lease to Supplier, a Subcontractor, Kraft or an Eligible
Recipient. Third Party Software also shall include all such Software that is
licensed and/or leased after the Commencement Date.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#147;Three Year Architectural Plan</font></b>&#148; shall mean the long-range,
comprehensive plan for Kraft&#146;s information technology systems, processes,
technical architecture and standards as described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 2.2</u></b><u> (Cross Functional &#151;
Equipment and Software Services)</u>.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Tower</b>&#148; shall mean any of the following components of the
Services:&#160; Cross Functional Services, <u>Application
Server Services, </u>Mainframe Services, Managed Network Services, or End User
Computing Services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transformation Milestone</b>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.3.3</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transformation Plan</b>&#148; means the plan or plans set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 22</u></b> and further developed
pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.3</u></b> hereof, which
identifies the principal changes in technology and deliverables to be
undertaken by Supplier in connection with the transformational activities to be
completed during and after the Transition Period, and the dates by which each
will be completed by Supplier.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transformation Services</b>&#148; shall mean the services, functions
and responsibilities described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.3</u></b>
and the Transformation Plan to be performed by Supplier.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">21</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-29.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:52 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transition Milestone</b>&#148; shall mean each date identified in the
Transition Plan and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 21</u></b>
as a milestone by which Supplier shall have completed a key task or set of
tasks in accordance with the Transition Plan in a manner acceptable to Kraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transition Period</b>&#148; shall mean the period that commences on
the Effective Date and expires 11:59:59 p.m., United States Central Time, on
the date specified for the completion of the Transition Services as specified
in the Transition Plan, unless expressly extended in writing by Kraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transition Plan</b>&#148; shall mean the plan or plans set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 21</u></b> and developed pursuant
to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.2</u></b> hereof, which
identifies all material transition tasks, Projects and deliverables to be
completed by Supplier in connection with the transition of Services to
Supplier, and the dates by which each is to be completed by Supplier.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transition Services</b>&#148; shall mean the services, functions and
responsibilities described in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 4.2</u></b>
and the Transition Plan to be performed by Supplier during the Transition
Period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transitioned Employees</b>&#148; shall mean the Affected Personnel
who accept offers of employment from Supplier, its Affiliates or Subcontractors
and become employed by such Entities pursuant to <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Article 8</u></b>.
Upon being employed by such Entities, such Transitioned Employees shall be
deemed to be Supplier Personnel as defined herein.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transport
Facilities</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the entire medium over which transport takes place, including the
Equipment and associated attachments, features, accessories, and peripherals
supported or provided by Supplier in connection with Transport Services (for
example, data access lines and circuits; voice access lines and trunks; ISDN
lines; copper and fiber; microwave, and satellite, routers, hubs, switches, and
PBXs).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transport </b></font><b>Services</b>&#148; shall mean a
commercial service providing the carriage or transmission of voice, video, or
data electronic impulses over a distance.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transport
Systems</b>&#148; </font>shall
mean all Transport Facilities and associated Software supported or provided by
Supplier in connection with the provision, monitoring or management of
Transport Services.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Transport
Vendor(s)</b>&#148; shall mean</font> a provider of Transport Services.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Unanticipated Change</b>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 11.7</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Upgrade</b>&#148; and its derivatives shall mean the updates,
renovations, enhancements, additions and/or new versions or releases of
Software or Equipment by Supplier. Unless otherwise agreed, financial
responsibility for the costs, fees and expenses associated with an Upgrade of
Software or Equipment shall be allocated between the Parties in accordance with
<b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Sections 6.4</u></b> and <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>WAN</b>&#148;
or &#147;<b>Wide Area Network</b>&#148; shall mean</font> a long haul, high speed transmission
Network, consisting of WAN Equipment, Software, Transport Systems, and
Interconnect Devices that are used to create, connect and transmit data, voice
and video signals to within, between or among:&#160;
(i)&nbsp;LANs; (ii)&nbsp;and non-Kraft locations that do business with
Kraft and for which Kraft is responsible for allowing Connectivity.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>WAN
Equipment</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the Equipment and associated attachments, features, accessories,
peripherals and Cabling supported or used by Supplier in connection with its
provision of WAN Services to the Authorized Users (e.g., routers, multiplexors,
access circuits, backbone circuits, channel banks,</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\JMS\danandhan\06-15579-1\task1280816\15579-1-ja-29.htm',USER='danandhan',CD='Aug  6 13:52 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CSU/DSUs, and associated diagnostic equipment), and all additions,
modifications, substitutions, Upgrades or enhancements to such Equipment.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#147;Warehouse Devices&#148; </font></b>shall have the meaning given in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Schedule 4.5</u></b>.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>WARN Act</b>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 8.11.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>welfare plans</b>&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in <b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Section 8.2.2</u></b>.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Wiring</b>&#148;
or &#147;<b>Wire</b>&#148; shall mean</font> the physical wire connection within walls,
between floors and between buildings terminating in a wall jack or other
equipment that allows a cable to be connected.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Yearly Performance Average</b>&#148; shall mean, with respect to each
Critical Service Level for which there was a Service Level Default during the
preceding Contract Year, the average of the Supplier&#146;s average monthly
performances in the Critical Service Level during the preceding Contract Year.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">23</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="79%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Goals and Objectives</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="87%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:87.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">DEFINITIONS AND DOCUMENTS</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="79%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Definitions</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="79%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other Terms</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">

 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.66%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="79%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Acquisition and Divestiture Services</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="87%" colspan="2" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:87.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">REQUIRED CONSENTS</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="79%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.66%;">

  </td>
  <td width="79%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Service Level Credits; Deliverable Credits</font></p>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.48%;">

  </td>
  <td width="79%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.62%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="7%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="79%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Network Configuration Data</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">77</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">103</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">114</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.22%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">123</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.64%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

<body lang="EN-US">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exhibit 10.29</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="163" height="66" src="g155791kai001.jpg"></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="51%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PERSONAL AND
  CONFIDENTIAL</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="46%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">June 22, 2006</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dear Irene,</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I am very pleased
to provide you with this letter confirming the verbal offer that I extended to
you for the position of Chief Executive Officer and a member of the Board of
Directors of Kraft Foods Inc. located in Northfield, IL.&#160; We have agreed that, in the event of a spin-off
of Kraft Foods from Altria Group, you will be appointed Chairman and Chief
Executive Officer.&#160; If you accept our
offer, we have discussed our interest in you joining Kraft on June 26,
2006.&#160; This letter sets forth all of the
terms and conditions of the offer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Listed below are
details of your compensation and benefits that will apply to this offer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Annualized
Compensation</font></u></b></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Target as a
percent of base salary.</p>

<br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You will be eligible to
participate in the Kraft Management Incentive Plan (MIP), which is the Company&#146;s
annual incentive program. Your target award opportunity under the MIP is equal
to 150% of your base salary. The actual amount you will receive is based upon
your individual performance and the performance of Kraft Foods Inc. Your 2006
award will represent a full year award, or as if you began employment on
January 1, 2006. This award will be paid at a minimum of your target in
February 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You will also be eligible
to participate in the Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP), which is the Company&#146;s
executive long-term cash incentive program. The current LTIP performance cycle
began on January 1, 2004 and is scheduled to end on December 31,2006. Your
eligibility in this performance cycle will be for one full year (2006), or as if
you began employment on January 1, 2006. This award will be paid at your target
in February 2007. Your target opportunity under the LTIP is equal to 250% of
your cumulative base salary during future performance cycles. The actual amount
you will receive is based upon your individual performance and the performance
of Kraft Foods Inc.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Also, you will be
eligible to participate in the Company&#146;s stock award program. Stock awards are
typically made on an annual basis, with the next award cycle anticipated to be
in January 2007. The current stock program design is to deliver 100% of equity
value in the form of restricted stock with a three-year cliff vest. Award size
is based on individual performance and requires the approval of the
Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Sign-On Incentives</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In recognition of the
forfeiture of equity awards granted by your previous employer, upon hire, you
will receive one-time sign-on incentives in the form of a pension bridge and
restricted stock as follows:</font></p>

  by the Company since 1981</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="23%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:23.28%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Benefit Formula
applied to service under the pension bridge will be the formula applicable to
employees with less than 30 years of service regardless of you actual service
at retirement. Your average annual compensation shall be no less than your
initial annual base salary and your initial MIP target award.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upon hire, you will
receive a one-time restricted stock award valued at $12,000,000. The number of
shares that you will receive will be determined based upon the fair market
value of Kraft Foods Inc. Common Stock on your</font></p>

and timing with that of Common Stock shareholders. The stock award will vest
based on the following schedule:</font></p>
